email_chain.subject: Freight Offer for Rice - Vung Tau to Vancouver
email_chain.body:
Hi Brandon,

We offer ATLANTIC SEA (DWT 55738, LOA 296m) for 8609MT Rice FOB Vung Tau to Vancouver at $85.42/MT. Laycan 25-30 June. Demurrage $15,000/day. Let me know your thoughts.

Best,
Lori

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Rice - Vung Tau to Vancouver
email_chain.body:
Hi Lori,

Thanks for the offer. Bunker prices have dropped recently. Can you revise the rate to reflect this? Also, can we extend laycan to 1-5 July?

Regards,
Brandon

email_chain.subject: Revised Freight Offer for Rice - Vung Tau to Vancouver
email_chain.body:
Hi Brandon,

Considering bunker price drop, we can revise rate to $83.50/MT. Laycan 1-5 July is acceptable. Demurrage remains $15,000/day. Please confirm.

Best,
Lori

email_chain.subject: Re: Revised Freight Offer for Rice - Vung Tau to Vancouver
email_chain.body:
Hi Lori,

$83.50/MT works for us. Please proceed with the fixture. Send over the recap for review.

Regards,
Brandon

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Vessel Needed for Aluminum Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Junior,

We urgently require a vessel to transport 5753MT of Aluminum from Hong Kong to Palma De Mallorca under CFR terms. Due to recent disruptions, we need to secure a vessel as soon as possible. Please provide your best freight quote and vessel details at the earliest.

Best regards,
Linda Campos
Cargo Logistics Inc.

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Vessel Needed for Aluminum Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Linda,

Thank you for your inquiry. We can offer the vessel 'EROS' (DWT: 284170, LOA: 330m) for your shipment. The laycan is 25-30 August. The freight rate is EUR68.28 per MT. Please confirm if this works for you.

Best regards,
Junior Dunn
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Vessel Needed for Aluminum Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Junior,

Thank you for the prompt response. The laycan works for us, but the freight rate seems high. Could you consider EUR65.00 per MT? Also, could you confirm the demurrage rate per day?

Best regards,
Linda Campos
Cargo Logistics Inc.

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Vessel Needed for Aluminum Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Linda,

We appreciate your counteroffer. Given the urgency and the current market conditions, the best we can do is EUR67.50 per MT. The demurrage rate is EUR12,000 per day. Please let us know if this is acceptable.

Best regards,
Junior Dunn
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Vessel Needed for Aluminum Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Junior,

Thank you for the revised offer. We can agree to EUR67.50 per MT. Please confirm the laycan remains 25-30 August and provide the charter party agreement for review.

Best regards,
Linda Campos
Cargo Logistics Inc.

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Vessel Needed for Aluminum Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Linda,

We confirm the laycan of 25-30 August. Attached is the charter party agreement for your review. Please sign and return at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Junior Dunn
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Vessel Needed for Aluminum Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Junior,

We have reviewed and signed the charter party agreement. Attached is the signed copy. Please confirm receipt and provide the vessel's ETA at Hong Kong.

Best regards,
Linda Campos
Cargo Logistics Inc.

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Vessel Needed for Aluminum Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Linda,

We have received the signed charter party agreement. The vessel 'EROS' is currently en route and is expected to arrive at Hong Kong on 25 August. We will keep you updated on any changes.

Best regards,
Junior Dunn
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Vessel Needed for Aluminum Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Junior,

Thank you for the confirmation. We look forward to the vessel's arrival and will coordinate with the loading terminal accordingly.

Best regards,
Linda Campos
Cargo Logistics Inc.

email_chain.subject: Freight Offer for Sugar from Gohyeon to Nord-Ostsee-Kanal
email_chain.body:
Dear Greg,

Hope you are well. We have a vessel MAERSK ESSEN (DWT 148723, LOA 366m) available for your sugar cargo of 5513MT from Gohyeon to Nord-Ostsee-Kanal on CIF basis. Starting freight quote is EUR73.58. Laycan is 25-30 May. Please let me know if this works for you.

Best regards,
Lori Daniel
Global Maritime Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar from Gohyeon to Nord-Ostsee-Kanal
email_chain.body:
Hi Lori,

Thanks for the offer. The rate seems a bit high. Can you consider EUR70.00? Also, we have additional cargo from Busan. Could we combine the loads to optimize the vessel's round trip?

Best,
Greg

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar from Gohyeon to Nord-Ostsee-Kanal
email_chain.body:
Dear Greg,

Thank you for your reply. Combining cargo from Busan is possible, but we need to adjust the laycan to 27 May - 1 June. The best rate I can offer for the combined load is EUR71.50. Please confirm if this is acceptable.

Best regards,
Lori

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar from Gohyeon to Nord-Ostsee-Kanal
email_chain.body:
Hi Lori,

EUR71.50 is still a bit high. Can we settle at EUR70.50? Also, what are the demurrage rates?

Best,
Greg

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar from Gohyeon to Nord-Ostsee-Kanal
email_chain.body:
Dear Greg,

We can agree on EUR70.50. Demurrage rate is USD12,000 per day. Please confirm the laycan and demurrage terms.

Best regards,
Lori

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar from Gohyeon to Nord-Ostsee-Kanal
email_chain.body:
Hi Lori,

EUR70.50 and demurrage at USD12,000 per day are acceptable. Please proceed with the laycan of 27 May - 1 June. Also, confirm the loading window and stem details.

Best,
Greg

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar from Gohyeon to Nord-Ostsee-Kanal
email_chain.body:
Dear Greg,

Thank you for your confirmation. Loading window is 48 hours, and stem details will be provided once the vessel is at the port. Please sign the attached fixture note and send it back.

Best regards,
Lori

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar from Gohyeon to Nord-Ostsee-Kanal
email_chain.body:
Hi Lori,

Fixture note signed and attached. Please confirm receipt and provide the vessel's ETA at Gohyeon.

Best,
Greg

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar from Gohyeon to Nord-Ostsee-Kanal
email_chain.body:
Dear Greg,

Fixture note received. Vessel's ETA at Gohyeon is 27 May at 0800 hours. We will keep you updated on any changes.

Best regards,
Lori

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar from Gohyeon to Nord-Ostsee-Kanal
email_chain.body:
Hi Lori,

Thank you for the update. We look forward to the vessel's arrival.

Best,
Greg

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Cotton from Barcelona to Luoyuan
email_chain.body:
Hi Andrew,

Hope you're well. Got your inquiry for 5492MT of cotton, DDP terms, from Barcelona to Luoyuan. Vessel THESEUS (DWT 153594, LOA 369m) is available. Starting freight rate is AUD65.34. Laycan 20-25 May. Let me know your thoughts.

Cheers,
Stephen

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Cotton from Barcelona to Luoyuan
email_chain.body:
Hi Stephen,

Thanks for the quote. AUD65.34 seems high for such a short voyage. Can you revise? Also, confirm demurrage rate and loading window.

Best,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Cotton from Barcelona to Luoyuan
email_chain.body:
Hi Andrew,

Fair point. How about AUD62.50? Demurrage rate is USD12,500/day. Loading window is 48 hours. Let me know if this works.

Cheers,
Stephen

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Cotton from Barcelona to Luoyuan
email_chain.body:
Hi Stephen,

AUD62.50 is better, but still high. Can you do AUD60.00? Also, confirm laytime start and end dates.

Best,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Cotton from Barcelona to Luoyuan
email_chain.body:
Hi Andrew,

AUD60.00 is a stretch, but I’ll check with the owner. Laytime is 20-25 May as mentioned. Will revert soon.

Cheers,
Stephen

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Cotton from Barcelona to Luoyuan
email_chain.body:
Hi Andrew,

Owner agreed to AUD60.50. Final offer. Laycan 20-25 May, loading window 48 hours, demurrage USD12,500/day. Let me know if we’re good to go.

Cheers,
Stephen

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Cotton from Barcelona to Luoyuan
email_chain.body:
Hi Stephen,

AUD60.50 works. Please confirm laytime start and end dates again, and send the recap.

Best,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Recap: Freight Quote for Cotton from Barcelona to Luoyuan
email_chain.body:
Hi Andrew,

Recap: 5492MT cotton, DDP, Barcelona to Luoyuan, vessel THESEUS, freight AUD60.50, laytime 20-25 May, loading window 48 hours, demurrage USD12,500/day. Please confirm.

Cheers,
Stephen

email_chain.subject: LNG Shipping Inquiry - CASTA DIVA
email_chain.body:
Hi Rene,

We have CASTA DIVA available for LNG transport from Duisburg to Long Beach. Cargo size 2404MT, DDP terms. Freight rate is USD63.06. Vessel specs: DWT 177807, LOA 292m, draft 12.5m, consumption 40MT/day. Laycan 25-30 Aug. Let me know if you need more details.

Best,
Travis

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Shipping Inquiry - CASTA DIVA
email_chain.body:
Hi Travis,

Thanks for the info. Can you confirm the vessel's loading rate and if it can accommodate a 72-hour loading window? Also, is the freight rate negotiable?

Best,
Rene

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Shipping Inquiry - CASTA DIVA
email_chain.body:
Hi Rene,

Loading rate is 12,000MT/day, so 72-hour window is no problem. Freight rate is firm at USD63.06 for now. Demurrage rate is $25,000/day. Let me know if you want to proceed.

Best,
Travis

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Shipping Inquiry - CASTA DIVA
email_chain.body:
Hi Travis,

Thanks for the details. We’re considering other options, but I’ll get back to you soon. Can you confirm the vessel’s ETA at Duisburg and if it’s grd/ga compliant?

Best,
Rene

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Shipping Inquiry - CASTA DIVA
email_chain.body:
Hi Rene,

ETA Duisburg is 24 Aug. Yes, vessel is grd/ga compliant. Let me know if you need anything else.

Best,
Travis

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Shipping Inquiry - CASTA DIVA
email_chain.body:
Hi Travis,

We’re ready to proceed, but can you lower the rate to USD60.00? Also, confirm the laycan and if the vessel is dwat compliant.

Best,
Rene

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Shipping Inquiry - CASTA DIVA
email_chain.body:
Hi Rene,

Best I can do is USD62.00. Laycan remains 25-30 Aug. Vessel is dwat compliant. Let me know if this works.

Best,
Travis

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Shipping Inquiry - CASTA DIVA
email_chain.body:
Hi Travis,

USD62.00 works. Please confirm the laytime and demurrage terms.

Best,
Rene

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Shipping Inquiry - CASTA DIVA
email_chain.body:
Hi Rene,

Laytime is 72 hours total, demurrage $25,000/day after that. I’ll send the fixture recap shortly.

Best,
Travis

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Shipping Inquiry - CASTA DIVA
email_chain.body:
Hi Travis,

Sounds good. Awaiting the recap.

Best,
Rene

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Vessel Needed for Soybeans from Alamitos Bay to Chittagong
email_chain.body:
Hi Anthony,

We urgently need a vessel to load 8254MT of soybeans FOB Alamitos Bay, discharge Chittagong. Laycan 25-30 Nov. Please quote ASAP.

email_chain.body:
Hi Eduardo,

Got your request. BARZAN (DWT 199744, LOA 400m) is available. Freight AUD76.28. Laycan 25-30 Nov works. Demurrage USD25k/day. Let me know if this suits.

Cheers,

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Vessel Needed for Soybeans from Alamitos Bay to Chittagong
email_chain.body:
Anthony,

Thanks for the quick response. AUD76.28 seems high. Can you do AUD74.00? Also, confirm stem at Alamitos Bay and loading window.

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Vessel Needed for Soybeans from Alamitos Bay to Chittagong
email_chain.body:
Eduardo,

AUD74.00 is tight, but I can do AUD75.00. Stem confirmed at Alamitos Bay, loading window 48 hours. Demurrage remains USD25k/day. Let me know if this works.

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Vessel Needed for Soybeans from Alamitos Bay to Chittagong
email_chain.body:
Anthony,

AUD75.00 works. Please proceed with BARZAN. Confirm laycan 25-30 Nov and send fixture recap.

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Soybeans from Denia to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Foster,

We are pleased to offer a freight rate of USD65.02 per MT for 2748MT of Soybeans from Denia to Xiamen, DDP. The vessel MARAN GAS ANDROS (DWT: 94638, LOA: 295m) is proposed. Please note, Xiamen port has draft restrictions; we recommend confirming suitability.

Kindly advise your laycan preferences.

Best regards,
Michael Bautista
Global Maritime Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Soybeans from Denia to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Dear Michael,

Thank you for the quote. We are considering a laycan of 15-20 April. Could you confirm if the vessel's draft complies with Xiamen's restrictions? Also, is there any flexibility on the rate?

Best,
Renee Foster

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Soybeans from Denia to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Foster,

The vessel's draft is within Xiamen's limits. Regarding the rate, we might consider a slight adjustment based on the final laycan confirmation. Could you confirm the loading window?

Best regards,
Michael Bautista

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Soybeans from Denia to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Dear Michael,

We can confirm the loading window as 15-17 April. Given this, could you revise the rate?

Best,
Renee Foster

email_chain.subject: Revised Freight Quote for Soybeans from Denia to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Foster,

Considering the confirmed loading window, we can adjust the rate to USD64.50 per MT. Please confirm acceptance at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Michael Bautista

email_chain.subject: Re: Revised Freight Quote for Soybeans from Denia to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Dear Michael,

We accept the revised rate of USD64.50 per MT. Please proceed with the necessary arrangements.

Best,
Renee Foster

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Booking for Soybeans from Denia to Xiamen
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Foster,

Booking confirmed for 2748MT of Soybeans on MARAN GAS ANDROS, loading 15-17 April, at USD64.50 per MT. We will send the charter party shortly.

Best regards,
Michael Bautista
Global Maritime Brokers

email_chain.subject: Proposal for Sugar Shipment - MARVEL EAGLE
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Zhang,

We are pleased to offer the vessel MARVEL EAGLE (DWT: 83571, LOA: 300m) for your shipment of 1466MT Sugar from Sydney to Istanbul on DDP terms. Freight rate is quoted at USD95.52 per MT. Laycan 10-15 Oct. Demurrage rate $15,000 per day. Please confirm your interest.

Best regards,
Adriana Amaya
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Proposal for Sugar Shipment - MARVEL EAGLE
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Amaya,

Thank you for your proposal. The rate seems high compared to current market levels. Could you consider reducing it to USD80.00 per MT? Also, can you confirm the vessel's availability for a loading window starting 10 Oct?

Best regards,
Sandy Zhang

email_chain.subject: Re: Proposal for Sugar Shipment - MARVEL EAGLE
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Zhang,

We appreciate your feedback. Considering our long-standing relationship, we can offer a revised rate of USD85.00 per MT. The vessel is confirmed available for your requested loading window. Please advise if this works for you.

Best regards,
Adriana Amaya
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Proposal for Sugar Shipment - MARVEL EAGLE
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Amaya,

Thank you for the revised quote. We propose a final rate of USD82.50 per MT. If acceptable, we can proceed with the fixture. Please confirm.

Best regards,
Sandy Zhang

email_chain.subject: Re: Proposal for Sugar Shipment - MARVEL EAGLE
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Zhang,

We accept your proposed rate of USD82.50 per MT. Please find attached the fixture recap for your review and confirmation. Looking forward to your prompt response.

Best regards,
Adriana Amaya
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Iron Ore - Kavkaz South Anch to Venice
email_chain.body: Hi Dustin, we have ULSAN EXPRESS available for your cargo. DWT 142023, LOA 367m. Rate is $91.70 CIF. Laycan 20-25 July. Let me know if you need more details. Best, Caroline

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore - Kavkaz South Anch to Venice
email_chain.body: Caroline, thanks for the offer. Rate seems high. Can you do better? Also, confirm laytime and demurrage rate. Best, Dustin

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore - Kavkaz South Anch to Venice
email_chain.body: Hi Dustin, laytime 72 hours, demurrage $15k/day. Best I can do is $85.50. Let me know. Best, Caroline

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore - Kavkaz South Anch to Venice
email_chain.body: Caroline, $85.50 still high. Market rate is closer to $80. Can you match? Also, confirm stem details. Best, Dustin

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore - Kavkaz South Anch to Venice
email_chain.body: Dustin, stem details: loading window 20-22 July. Rate $82.50 is final offer. Let me know if you gtee the cargo. Best, Caroline

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore - Kavkaz South Anch to Venice
email_chain.body: Caroline, $82.50 works. Cargo gtee confirmed. Please send fixture recap. Best, Dustin

email_chain.subject: Fwd: Fixture Recap - Iron Ore - Kavkaz South Anch to Venice
email_chain.body: Dustin, fixture recap sent. Laycan 20-25 July, laytime 72 hours, demurrage $15k/day. Rate $82.50 CIF. Confirm receipt. Best, Caroline

email_chain.subject: Re: Fixture Recap - Iron Ore - Kavkaz South Anch to Venice
email_chain.body: Caroline, recap received and confirmed. Thanks for your help. Best, Dustin

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Sugar from Gibraltar to Bandar Abbas Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Ashley,

We have the ATHERINA available for your cargo of 12339MT sugar from Gibraltar to Bandar Abbas Anch. The vessel has a DWT of 319471 and LOA of 340m. Starting freight quote is $52.53 per MT CFR.

Please let us know your thoughts.

Best regards,
Blake Wells
Anderson Shipping Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Sugar from Gibraltar to Bandar Abbas Anch
email_chain.body:
Hi Blake,

Thanks for the quote. We note the vessel won’t be fully loaded, which should reduce draft and potentially lower port surcharges. Can you confirm if this will affect the rate?

Also, could you provide the laycan and demurrage rate per day?

Best,
Ashley

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Sugar from Gibraltar to Bandar Abbas Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Ashley,

Yes, partial load will save on fees. Laycan is 25-30 June. Demurrage rate is $15,000 per day.

Let me know if you need further details.

Best regards,
Blake

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Sugar from Gibraltar to Bandar Abbas Anch
email_chain.body:
Hi Blake,

Thanks for the info. Considering the partial load, can we negotiate the rate down to $50.00 per MT?

Best,
Ashley

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Sugar from Gibraltar to Bandar Abbas Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Ashley,

We can offer $51.00 per MT considering the partial load. Let me know if this works for you.

Best regards,
Blake

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Sugar from Gibraltar to Bandar Abbas Anch
email_chain.body:
Hi Blake,

$51.00 per MT is acceptable. Please confirm the laycan and demurrage rate.

Best,
Ashley

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Sugar from Gibraltar to Bandar Abbas Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Ashley,

Confirmed: laycan 25-30 June, demurrage rate $15,000 per day. Please proceed with the necessary arrangements.

Best regards,
Blake

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Sugar from Gibraltar to Bandar Abbas Anch
email_chain.body:
Hi Blake,

Thank you. We will proceed with the arrangements and confirm shortly.

Best,
Ashley

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Crude Oil - Taixing to Qushan

Please find below our freight quote for your consideration:

- Commodity: Crude Oil
- Load Port: Taixing
- Discharge Port: Qushan
- Cargo Size: 868MT
- Vessel: GLOVIS ADVANCE (DWT: 179217, LOA: 292m)

Laycan: 5-10 Feb
Loading Window: 48 hrs
Demurrage: $15,000 per day

Please let us know if you need further details.

Amy Blanco
Global Maritime Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil - Taixing to Qushan

Thank you for the quote. However, we have historical data showing similar shipments at $35.50 per MT under comparable conditions. Can you match this rate?

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil - Taixing to Qushan

Amy Blanco
Global Maritime Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Crude Oil - Taixing to Qushan

email_chain.subject: Freight Offer for Crude Oil from Ust-Luga to Yalova
email_chain.body:

Hope you're well. We have the C.S. BRILLIANCE available for your cargo of 1812MT Crude Oil from Ust-Luga to Yalova on FOB basis. Starting freight rate is USD39 per MT. Vessel details: DWT 208480, LOA 300m. Laycan 20-25 Nov. Let me know your thoughts.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil from Ust-Luga to Yalova

Thanks for the offer. USD39 seems a bit high given current market rates. Can you do better? Also, can you confirm the loading window and demurrage rate?

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil from Ust-Luga to Yalova
email_chain.body:
Hi Gloria,

Understood. Given the rising bunker costs, we can offer USD37.50 with a BAF surcharge of USD1.50. Loading window is 24-48 hours, demurrage at $15,000 per day. Let me know if this works.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil from Ust-Luga to Yalova

Hi Nikki,

Thanks for the update. We can agree to USD37.50 but the BAF surcharge is a bit steep. Can we cap it at USD1.00? Also, can we extend the laycan to 22-27 Nov?

Gloria

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil from Ust-Luga to Yalova
email_chain.body:

We can cap the BAF at USD1.00 and adjust laycan to 22-27 Nov. Final freight rate would be USD38.50. Please confirm so we can proceed with the stem.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil from Ust-Luga to Yalova

email_chain.subject: Re: Contract for Crude Oil from Ust-Luga to Yalova

email_chain.subject: Wheat shipment from Jimiya to Quebec
email_chain.body:
Hi Brandon,

Got your inquiry for 221MT Wheat from Jimiya to Quebec on DDP terms. Vessel ATBAN (DWT 300361, LOA 340m) is available. Rate in low 60s USD/MT. Laycan 10-15 Jan. Let me know if this works.

Cheers,
Daniela

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat shipment from Jimiya to Quebec
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniela,

Thanks for the quick reply. Low 60s seems a bit steep. Can you do mid-50s? Also, can you confirm the demurrage rate? We’re open to partial prepayment if it helps.

Best,
Brandon

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat shipment from Jimiya to Quebec
email_chain.body:
Hi Brandon,

Mid-50s is too tight, but I can do $58/MT if you confirm today. Demurrage is $12,500/day. Prepayment works for us—let me know how much you’re thinking.

Cheers,
Daniela

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat shipment from Jimiya to Quebec
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniela,

$58/MT works if you can extend the laycan to 10-18 Jan. We’ll prepay 50%. Can you confirm the stem and loading window?

Best,
Brandon

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat shipment from Jimiya to Quebec
email_chain.body:
Hi Brandon,

Deal. Laycan extended to 10-18 Jan. Stem confirmed at Jimiya, loading window 48 hours. Send the prepayment details, and we’ll lock it in.

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Sugar Shipment - Meizhou Island to Zhanjiang Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Beatriz,

We are pleased to provide you with a freight quote for the shipment of 5224MT of sugar from Meizhou Island to Zhanjiang Anch. The vessel proposed is the BILBAO KNUTSEN, with a DWT of 77217 and LOA of 284m.

The starting freight quote is AUD50.66 per metric ton, DDP terms. Please note that this rate is subject to negotiation based on laycan and other operational details.

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Peggy Vasquez
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Sugar Shipment - Meizhou Island to Zhanjiang Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Peggy,

Thank you for the prompt quote. Considering the efficiency of the loading port at Meizhou Island, which typically has a fast turnaround time, we believe the rate should reflect the reduced operational costs. Could you consider revising the rate to AUD48.00 per metric ton?

Additionally, could you confirm the laycan and any details regarding the loading window?

Best regards,
Beatriz Nuñez

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Sugar Shipment - Meizhou Island to Zhanjiang Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Beatriz,

Thank you for your feedback. While we acknowledge the efficiency of Meizhou Island, the current market conditions and the specifics of the BILBAO KNUTSEN necessitate a rate of AUD50.00 per metric ton. This rate is competitive and reflects the vessel's capabilities and the DDP terms.

The laycan is set for 25th to 30th March, with a loading window of 72 hours. Please let us know if this aligns with your schedule.

Best regards,
Peggy Vasquez
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Sugar Shipment - Meizhou Island to Zhanjiang Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Peggy,

We appreciate your consideration. However, we would like to propose a final rate of AUD49.00 per metric ton, considering the operational efficiencies and the current market trends. Please confirm if this is acceptable.

Also, could you provide details on the demurrage rate per day?

Best regards,
Beatriz Nuñez

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Sugar Shipment - Meizhou Island to Zhanjiang Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Beatriz,

After further consideration, we can agree to a rate of AUD49.00 per metric ton, DDP terms. The demurrage rate is set at AUD12,000 per day, pro rata.

Please confirm your acceptance so we can proceed with the necessary arrangements.

Best regards,
Peggy Vasquez
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Sugar Shipment - Meizhou Island to Zhanjiang Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Peggy,

We accept the rate of AUD49.00 per metric ton and the demurrage rate of AUD12,000 per day. Please proceed with the charter party agreement under NYPE terms.

Could you also confirm the stem date and any additional operational details?

Best regards,
Beatriz Nuñez

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Sugar Shipment - Meizhou Island to Zhanjiang Anch
email_chain.body:

Should you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Best regards,
Peggy Vasquez
Oceanic Trade Services

Looking forward to your response.

Edgar Jones

Felipe Hansen

email_chain.subject: Market Update: Coal Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Mari,

I hope this email finds you well. I wanted to provide you with a quick update on the current market situation for coal shipments from Banjarmasin to Travemunde.

Freight rates are currently hovering around USD83 per metric ton, but we’re seeing some volatility due to limited vessel availability. The CAPE SHANGHAI (DWT: 176460, LOA: 292m) is one of the few vessels that could accommodate your cargo size of 7324MT. However, the laycan is tight, and we’d need to secure a loading window soon.

Let me know if you’d like to explore this further or if you have any specific requirements.

Best regards,
Sophia Khan
Anderson Shipping Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Coal Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Sophia,

Thanks for the update. USD83 seems a bit high given the current market conditions. Could you clarify if this rate includes demurrage, and what the laycan window looks like for the CAPE SHANGHAI?

Also, is the vessel SOC or PDPR?

Best,
Mari

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Coal Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Mari,

Thanks for your prompt response. The rate of USD83 is based on DAP terms and excludes demurrage, which would be charged at USD12,500 per day pro rata. The laycan for the CAPE SHANGHAI is currently set for 25-30 August, but this could shift slightly depending on berth availability at Banjarmasin.

The vessel is PDPR, and we can confirm SOC if needed. Let me know if you’d like to proceed or if you’d like me to explore other options.

Best regards,
Sophia

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Coal Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Sophia,

Thanks for the details. The laycan works for us, but we’d like to counter at USD78.50, given the current market trends. Also, could you confirm the stem details and loading rate?

Best,
Mari

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Coal Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Mari,

I’ve discussed your counteroffer with the owner, and they’re willing to meet you halfway at USD80.75. The loading rate is 10,000MT per weather working day, and the stem details are as follows: Banjarmasin to Travemunde, DAP terms, with a laytime of 72 hours total.

Let me know if this works for you, and I’ll draft the fixture recap.

Best regards,
Sophia

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Coal Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Sophia,

USD80.75 is acceptable. Please proceed with the fixture recap, and confirm the laycan and demurrage rate once finalized.

Best,
Mari

email_chain.subject: Fixture Recap: CAPE SHANGHAI - Banjarmasin to Travemunde
email_chain.body:
Hi Mari,

Please find below the fixture recap for your review:

- Vessel: CAPE SHANGHAI
- Cargo: 7324MT Coal
- Load Port: Banjarmasin
- Discharge Port: Travemunde
- Laycan: 25-30 August 2018
- Freight Rate: USD80.75 per MT, DAP
- Demurrage: USD12,500 per day pro rata
- Loading Rate: 10,000MT per WWD
- Terms: PDPR, SOC

Let me know if everything looks good, and I’ll finalize the charter party.

Best regards,
Sophia

email_chain.subject: Initial Freight Quote for LNG Shipment - Zaandam to Sanya
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Reid,

I hope this email finds you well. We are pleased to provide you with an initial freight quote for the shipment of 10017MT of LNG from Zaandam to Sanya on a CFR basis. The vessel we propose is the EVER GOVERN, with a DWT of 198937 and an LOA of 400m.

The starting freight quote is $80.80 per metric ton. Please note that this rate is subject to negotiation and may vary based on specific terms and conditions.

We look forward to your feedback and are available to discuss any further details or clarifications you may require.

Best regards,
Jacob Zavala
Anderson Shipping Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Initial Freight Quote for LNG Shipment - Zaandam to Sanya
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Zavala,

Thank you for your prompt response and the initial freight quote. We have reviewed the details and would like to point out that the chosen ports, Zaandam and Sanya, have relatively lower terminal and harbor fees compared to other options. Given this, we would appreciate it if you could consider a more competitive rate.

Additionally, could you please provide more details on the laycan and the loading window for this shipment?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Theresa Reid

email_chain.subject: Re: Initial Freight Quote for LNG Shipment - Zaandam to Sanya
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Reid,

Thank you for your feedback. We understand your point regarding the port fees and are willing to revisit the freight rate. After further consideration, we can offer a revised rate of $78.50 per metric ton.

Regarding the laycan, we propose a window from December 15 to December 20, 2024. The loading window is set for 48 hours, and the demurrage rate is $25,000 per day.

Please let us know if this revised rate and the proposed laycan are acceptable to you.

Best regards,
Jacob Zavala
Anderson Shipping Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Revised Freight Quote for LNG Shipment - Zaandam to Sanya
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Zavala,

Thank you for the revised quote and the details on the laycan and loading window. We appreciate the adjustment in the freight rate. However, we would like to propose a further reduction to $76.00 per metric ton, considering the lower port fees and the current market conditions.

Additionally, could you confirm the stem date and any potential delays that might affect the loading window?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Theresa Reid

email_chain.subject: Re: Further Negotiation on Freight Quote for LNG Shipment - Zaandam to Sanya
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Reid,

We have reviewed your counter-proposal and, after careful consideration, we can agree to a freight rate of $76.50 per metric ton. This rate reflects our best offer given the current market conditions and the lower port fees you mentioned.

The stem date is confirmed for December 15, 2024, and we do not anticipate any delays that would affect the loading window. However, we will keep you updated should there be any changes.

Please confirm your acceptance of this rate and the laycan so we can proceed with the necessary arrangements.

Best regards,
Jacob Zavala
Anderson Shipping Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Final Freight Quote for LNG Shipment - Zaandam to Sanya
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Zavala,

Thank you for your flexibility and the final freight quote of $76.50 per metric ton. We accept this rate and the proposed laycan from December 15 to December 20, 2024.

Please proceed with the necessary arrangements and provide us with the contract details at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Theresa Reid

email_chain.subject: Re: Contract Details for LNG Shipment - Zaandam to Sanya
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Reid,

Thank you for confirming the freight rate and laycan. We are now preparing the contract details and will send them over to you by the end of the day.

Should you have any further questions or require additional information, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Best regards,
Jacob Zavala
Anderson Shipping Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Contract Details for LNG Shipment - Zaandam to Sanya
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Zavala,

Thank you for the update. We look forward to receiving the contract details and will review them promptly upon receipt.

Best regards,
Theresa Reid

email_chain.subject: Firm Offer for LNG Shipment - Yantai to Port Harcourt
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Osorio,

We are pleased to offer you the vessel PACIFIC CORAL (DWT: 265278, LOA: 324m) for the shipment of 5083MT of LNG from Yantai to Port Harcourt on FOB terms. The freight rate is quoted at €90 per metric ton. The laycan is set for 15-20 July 2014, with a loading window of 72 hours. Demurrage rate is set at €25,000 per day, pro rata.

Please confirm your acceptance at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Joel De Leon
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Firm Offer for LNG Shipment - Yantai to Port Harcourt
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. De Leon,

Thank you for your offer. We note that the vessel will not be fully loaded, which should result in a reduced draft and potentially lower port surcharges. Could you please confirm if this has been factored into the freight rate?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Amy Osorio

email_chain.subject: Re: Firm Offer for LNG Shipment - Yantai to Port Harcourt
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Osorio,

Thank you for your prompt response. The reduced draft due to partial loading has indeed been considered in the freight rate. However, we are open to discussing a revised rate if you have a specific figure in mind.

Please let us know your thoughts.

Best regards,
Joel De Leon
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Firm Offer for LNG Shipment - Yantai to Port Harcourt
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. De Leon,

Considering the reduced draft and potential savings on port surcharges, we propose a revised freight rate of €85 per metric ton. Please confirm if this is acceptable.

Best regards,
Amy Osorio

email_chain.subject: Re: Firm Offer for LNG Shipment - Yantai to Port Harcourt
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Osorio,

We appreciate your revised offer. After careful consideration, we can agree to a freight rate of €87 per metric ton. This rate reflects the reduced draft and associated savings.

Please confirm your acceptance so we can proceed with the necessary arrangements.

Best regards,
Joel De Leon
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Firm Offer for LNG Shipment - Yantai to Port Harcourt
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. De Leon,

Thank you for your revised offer. We accept the freight rate of €87 per metric ton. Please proceed with the necessary arrangements and confirm the laycan and loading window.

Best regards,
Amy Osorio

email_chain.subject: Re: Firm Offer for LNG Shipment - Yantai to Port Harcourt
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Osorio,

Thank you for your confirmation. The laycan remains 15-20 July 2014, with a loading window of 72 hours. We will send you the charter party agreement shortly for your review and signature.

Best regards,
Joel De Leon
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Firm Offer for LNG Shipment - Yantai to Port Harcourt
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Corn Shipment from Harlingen to Huanghua
email_chain.body:
Dear Ricky,

I hope this email finds you well. We are looking to charter a vessel for a shipment of 10,432 MT of corn from Harlingen to Huanghua. The incoterm we are considering is FOB. Could you provide a freight quote and vessel options? Please include details on laycan and demurrage rates.

Best regards,
Doug Martínez

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Corn Shipment from Harlingen to Huanghua
email_chain.body:
Dear Doug,

Thank you for your inquiry. For the shipment of 10,432 MT of corn from Harlingen to Huanghua, we can offer the vessel GEMMA, which has a DWT of 313,049 and an LOA of 330m. The initial freight quote is €67.53 per MT under FOB terms. The laycan is set for June 15-20, and the demurrage rate is $12,000 per day.

Please let me know if this works for you or if you need further details.

Best regards,
Ricky Velasquez

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Corn Shipment from Harlingen to Huanghua
email_chain.body:
Dear Ricky,

Thank you for the prompt response. We are considering switching the incoterm to DAP. Could you provide an updated freight quote and clarify the responsibilities under DAP terms? Also, can you confirm the loading window and stem details?

Best regards,
Doug Martínez

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Corn Shipment from Harlingen to Huanghua
email_chain.body:
Dear Doug,

Under DAP terms, the updated freight quote would be €70.15 per MT. This includes delivery at the discharge port, with all responsibilities for unloading falling on the buyer. The loading window remains June 15-20, and the stem details will be confirmed once the charter party is finalized.

Please let me know if this adjustment aligns with your requirements.

Best regards,
Ricky Velasquez

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Corn Shipment from Harlingen to Huanghua
email_chain.body:
Dear Ricky,

Thank you for the updated quote. We are comfortable with the DAP terms and the freight rate of €70.15 per MT. Could you please confirm the laytime start and end dates, and provide the final demurrage rate? Additionally, we would appreciate it if you could include the adcom and wccon clauses in the charter party.

Best regards,
Doug Martínez

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Corn Shipment from Harlingen to Huanghua
email_chain.body:
Dear Doug,

I am pleased to confirm the laytime start date as June 15 and the end date as June 20. The final demurrage rate is set at $12,000 per day. I will ensure that the adcom and wccon clauses are included in the charter party. Please review the attached draft and let me know if any further adjustments are needed.

Best regards,
Ricky Velasquez

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Cotton from Rizhao to Cairns
email_chain.body:
Dear Daniela,

I hope this email finds you well. Following up on our recent discussion, I’m pleased to provide you with a freight quote for the shipment of 9792MT of cotton from Rizhao to Cairns on a CFR basis.

We can offer the vessel OOCL TAIPEI (DWT: 101147, LOA: 335m) at a rate of EUR56 per metric ton. The laycan is tentatively set for 2021-06-01 to 2021-06-05, subject to confirmation. The demurrage rate is USD 12,000 per day, pro rata.

Please note that the port of Rizhao is currently experiencing some congestion due to adverse weather conditions, which may slightly impact the loading window. However, we are closely monitoring the situation and will keep you updated.

Looking forward to your feedback.

Best regards,
Billy Hernández
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Cotton from Rizhao to Cairns
email_chain.body:
Hi Billy,

Thank you for the prompt response. The rate of EUR56 seems a bit on the higher side, especially considering the current market trends. We are also exploring alternative transport modes, such as rail and road, which could offer more competitive rates.

Could you please clarify if the laycan is flexible? Additionally, are there any additional charges we should be aware of, apart from the demurrage?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best,
Daniela García
Cotton Logistics

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Cotton from Rizhao to Cairns
email_chain.body:
Dear Daniela,

Thank you for your email. I understand your concerns regarding the rate. Given the current market conditions and the specific requirements for this shipment, EUR56 is a competitive offer. However, I can explore further options if you have a target rate in mind.

Regarding the laycan, we do have some flexibility, but it would depend on the vessel’s schedule and port availability. As for additional charges, the only other cost would be the adcom (address commission) of 1.25%, which is standard in our contracts.

On a side note, I recently read that the port of Cairns has implemented new environmental regulations, which might slightly affect the discharge operations. However, this should not impact our timeline significantly.

Please let me know your thoughts.

Best regards,
Billy Hernández
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Cotton from Rizhao to Cairns
email_chain.body:
Hi Billy,

Thanks for the additional details. Considering the adcom and the flexibility in laycan, we would be more comfortable with a rate of EUR52. This aligns better with our budget and the rates we are seeing from other transport modes.

Could you also confirm the stem (loading window) and if there are any restrictions on the cargo size? Additionally, any updates on the weather conditions in Rizhao would be appreciated.

Looking forward to your response.

Best,
Daniela García
Cotton Logistics

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Cotton from Rizhao to Cairns
email_chain.body:
Dear Daniela,

Thank you for your counteroffer. After reviewing the market conditions and considering our long-standing relationship, I can offer a revised rate of EUR54 per metric ton. This rate is inclusive of the adcom and reflects the best we can do at this time.

The stem is confirmed for 2021-06-01 to 2021-06-05, with no restrictions on the cargo size. The weather in Rizhao has improved, and we expect the loading operations to proceed smoothly.

Please let me know if this works for you, and we can proceed with the necessary documentation.

Best regards,
Billy Hernández
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Soybeans CFR Newport Beach
email_chain.body:
Dear Marie,

I hope this email finds you well. We are pleased to offer you a freight quote for the shipment of 11,152 MT of soybeans from Fos Sur Mer to Newport Beach on a CFR basis. The vessel we propose is the GENCO TIGER, with a DWT of 179,185 and an LOA of 292m. The starting freight quote is in the high 60s USD per metric ton.

Please let us know if you require any additional details or if you have any questions regarding the vessel or the terms.

Best regards,
Gregory Lucas
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Soybeans CFR Newport Beach
email_chain.body:
Hi Gregory,

Thank you for the prompt response and the details provided. The rate in the high 60s seems a bit steep for us. Would you consider a lower rate if we agree to a partial prepayment? Also, could you confirm the laycan and the demurrage rate per day?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best,
Marie Orellana

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Soybeans CFR Newport Beach
email_chain.body:
Dear Marie,

Thank you for your email. Considering your proposal for a partial prepayment, we could adjust the rate to $68 per metric ton. The laycan is set for January 10-15, 2010, and the demurrage rate is $15,000 per day.

Please let us know if this works for you or if you have any further conditions.

Best regards,
Gregory Lucas
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Soybeans CFR Newport Beach
email_chain.body:
Hi Gregory,

Thanks for the revised quote. We are comfortable with the rate of $68 per metric ton and the laycan dates. However, we would like to request a slight adjustment in the demurrage rate to $14,000 per day. Could you accommodate this?

Best,
Marie Orellana

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Soybeans CFR Newport Beach
email_chain.body:
Dear Marie,

We have reviewed your request and are pleased to agree to a demurrage rate of $14,000 per day. To summarize, the freight rate is set at $68 per metric ton, with a laycan of January 10-15, 2010, and a demurrage rate of $14,000 per day.

Please confirm your acceptance so we can proceed with the necessary arrangements.

Best regards,
Gregory Lucas
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Soybeans CFR Newport Beach
email_chain.body:
Hi Gregory,

We accept the terms as outlined. Please proceed with the arrangements, and we will initiate the partial prepayment as discussed.

Thank you for your cooperation and looking forward to a successful shipment.

Best,
Marie Orellana

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Aluminum Shipment Neustadt to Port Klang
email_chain.body:
Dear Andres,

I hope this email finds you well. We are looking to charter a vessel for an Aluminum shipment of 10,783 MT from Neustadt to Port Klang on DAP terms. Could you please provide a freight quote and suggest a suitable vessel? We are targeting a loading window around mid-June.

Andre Andrade
Cargo Logistics Inc.

email_chain.body:
Dear Andre,

Thank you for your inquiry. We can offer the vessel CARNIVAL CONQUEST (DWT: 10,000, LOA: 290m) for this shipment. The freight rate is quoted at USD 71.63 per MT. Laycan is proposed for June 15-20. Demurrage rate is USD 12,500 per day, pro rata.

Please let me know if this works for you or if you need further details.

Best regards,
Andres Young
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Aluminum Shipment Neustadt to Port Klang
email_chain.body:

Thank you for the prompt response. The rate seems a bit high for our budget. Could you consider revising it to around USD 68.00 per MT? Also, can you confirm if the vessel is equipped with gear for loading?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Andre Andrade
Cargo Logistics Inc.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Aluminum Shipment Neustadt to Port Klang
email_chain.body:
Dear Andre,

Thanks for your feedback. Unfortunately, USD 68.00 is below our current market rate. The best I can do is USD 70.00 per MT. The CARNIVAL CONQUEST is gearless, so we would need to arrange for shore cranes at Neustadt.

Let me know if this revised rate works for you.

Best regards,
Andres Young
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Rice Cargo - San Diego to San Juan
email_chain.body:
Dear Fernando,

I hope this email finds you well. We are pleased to offer you the vessel ATBAN for your rice cargo of 10,676 MT from San Diego to San Juan on DDP terms. The vessel has a DWT of 300,361 and an LOA of 340m, making it an excellent fit for your requirements.

Our initial freight quote is USD 61 per MT. The laycan is set for June 15-20, 2012, with a loading window of 72 hours. The demurrage rate is USD 25,000 per day.

Please let us know if this works for you or if you have any further questions.

Best regards,
Chelsea Herrera
Seaway Commercial Brokers

email_chain.body:
Hi Chelsea,

Thank you for the prompt response. However, the rate of USD 61 per MT seems a bit high for this route. Given the current market conditions, we were expecting something closer to USD 50 per MT. Could you please review and adjust the rate accordingly?

Additionally, could you confirm the laycan and loading window details?

Best regards,
Fernando Hunt

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Rice Cargo - San Diego to San Juan
email_chain.body:
Dear Fernando,

Thank you for your feedback. After reviewing the market conditions, we can offer a revised rate of USD 55 per MT. This is a significant discount from our initial quote and reflects our commitment to providing competitive rates.

The laycan remains June 15-20, 2012, with a loading window of 72 hours. Please note that the demurrage rate remains at USD 25,000 per day.

Let us know if this revised rate works for you.

Best regards,
Chelsea Herrera
Seaway Commercial Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Rice Cargo - San Diego to San Juan
email_chain.body:
Hi Chelsea,

Thank you for the revised quote. We appreciate the adjustment, but we are still hoping to secure a rate closer to USD 50 per MT. Could you please consider this and let us know if it's possible?

Also, could you confirm the stem details and any additional charges that might apply?

Best regards,
Fernando Hunt

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Rice Cargo - San Diego to San Juan
email_chain.body:
Dear Fernando,

We understand your position and have reviewed the rate once more. We can offer a final rate of USD 52 per MT, which we believe is very competitive given the current market conditions.

The laycan remains June 15-20, 2012, with a loading window of 72 hours. The demurrage rate is USD 25,000 per day. There are no additional charges beyond what we have already discussed.

Please confirm your acceptance of this rate so we can proceed with the necessary arrangements.

Best regards,
Chelsea Herrera
Seaway Commercial Brokers

Dear Mr. Lee,

Thank you for your offer. However, considering the lower terminal and harbor fees at both Recalada and Buenos Aires, we would like to negotiate a more competitive rate. Could you consider reducing the freight rate to $30 per metric ton?

Additionally, could you confirm the stem details and any potential delays in the loading window?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Judith Gray

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Iron Ore from Recalada to Buenos Aires
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Gray,

Thank you for your prompt response. We understand your concerns regarding the port fees. After reviewing the current market conditions, we can offer a revised freight rate of $31 per metric ton.

Regarding the stem, the vessel UMM AL ASHTAN is currently en route and is expected to arrive at Recalada on schedule. The loading window remains at 72 hours, and we do not anticipate any delays.

Please let us know if this revised rate is acceptable.

Best regards,
Alan Lee
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Iron Ore from Recalada to Buenos Aires
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lee,

Thank you for your revised offer. We appreciate the adjustment to $31 per metric ton. However, we would like to propose a final rate of $30.50 per metric ton, considering the lower port fees and the current market trends.

Could you confirm if this rate is acceptable? Additionally, please provide the final laycan dates and any updates on the vessel's ETA.

Best regards,
Judith Gray

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Iron Ore from Recalada to Buenos Aires
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Gray,

We have reviewed your proposal and are pleased to confirm the final freight rate of $30.50 per metric ton for the shipment of 2454MT of Iron Ore from Recalada to Buenos Aires on the vessel UMM AL ASHTAN.

The laycan remains 25-30 September 2005, and the vessel is expected to arrive at Recalada on 25 September as scheduled. The loading window is confirmed at 72 hours, and the demurrage rate remains at $12,000 per day.

Please confirm your acceptance of these terms at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Alan Lee
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Palm Oil Shipment - Musaffah to Fort Lauderdale
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. John,

I hope this email finds you well. We are pleased to provide you with a freight quote for the shipment of 9499MT of Palm Oil from Musaffah to Fort Lauderdale under DDP terms. The vessel proposed is the GAZA MARINE TERMINAL, with a DWT of 265869 and LOA of 338m.

Given the high-risk nature of the route, which includes areas with significant war risk and piracy concerns, we are proposing a starting freight rate of €99 per MT. This rate includes a war risk premium and piracy surcharge to ensure comprehensive coverage.

Please note that the laycan is set for 15-20 March 2016, with a loading window of 72 hours. The demurrage rate is set at €15,000 per day, pro rata.

We look forward to your feedback and are available to discuss any adjustments or clarifications you may require.

Best regards,
Billy Paz
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Palm Oil Shipment - Musaffah to Fort Lauderdale
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Paz,

Thank you for your prompt response and the detailed quote. We are currently reviewing the terms and have a few concerns regarding the freight rate. Considering the current market conditions, we were anticipating a rate closer to €90 per MT. Could you please provide a revised quote reflecting this rate?

Additionally, could you confirm the stem dates and any potential adjustments to the laycan if we proceed with the shipment?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Victoria John

email_chain.subject: Revised Freight Quote for Palm Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. John,

Thank you for your feedback. After careful consideration, we are able to adjust the freight rate to €95 per MT. This revised rate still includes the necessary war risk premium and piracy surcharge, which are non-negotiable due to the high-risk nature of the route.

Regarding the stem dates, we can confirm that the vessel will be ready to load between 15-20 March 2016, as previously stated. We are unable to adjust the laycan at this time due to prior commitments.

Please let us know if this revised rate is acceptable to you, and we can proceed with the necessary arrangements.

Best regards,
Billy Paz
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Revised Freight Quote for Palm Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Paz,

Thank you for the revised quote. We appreciate the adjustment and are prepared to accept the rate of €95 per MT. Please proceed with the booking under the terms discussed.

Could you also confirm the demurrage rate and any additional charges that may apply? We would like to ensure all financial aspects are clear before finalizing the agreement.

Looking forward to your confirmation.

Best regards,
Victoria John

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Booking and Final Terms
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. John,

Thank you for your confirmation. We are pleased to proceed with the booking for the shipment of 9499MT of Palm Oil from Musaffah to Fort Lauderdale at the agreed rate of €95 per MT.

To confirm, the demurrage rate is €15,000 per day, pro rata, and there are no additional charges beyond those previously discussed. The laycan remains 15-20 March 2016, with a 72-hour loading window.

We will send through the final contract for your review and signature shortly. Should you have any further questions or require additional information, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Best regards,
Billy Paz
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Corn Shipment from Paris to Prince Rupert
email_chain.body:
Dear Sean,

I hope this email finds you well. We are looking to charter a vessel for a shipment of 10,235 MT of corn from Paris to Prince Rupert on CFR terms. Could you please provide us with some freight quotes and vessel options?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Karla Price

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Corn Shipment from Paris to Prince Rupert
email_chain.body:
Dear Karla,

Thank you for your inquiry. We have two options for your consideration:

1. Vessel: EXPRESS ROME (DWT: 122961, LOA: 349m)
   Freight: €71 per MT
   Laycan: 1-5 Oct
   Demurrage: $15,000 per day

2. Vessel: FLEX ENDEAVOUR (DWT: 95803, LOA: 295m)
   Freight: €69 per MT
   Laycan: 3-7 Oct
   Demurrage: $14,000 per day

Please let us know your preference or if you need further details.

Best regards,
Sean Calderon

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Corn Shipment from Paris to Prince Rupert
email_chain.body:
Dear Sean,

Thank you for the prompt response. We are inclined towards the EXPRESS ROME. However, could you please clarify if the freight rate is negotiable? Also, could you confirm the loading window?

Best regards,
Karla Price

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Corn Shipment from Paris to Prince Rupert
email_chain.body:
Dear Karla,

Regarding the EXPRESS ROME, the freight rate is slightly negotiable. We could consider €70 per MT. The loading window is firm at 1-5 Oct. Please let us know if this works for you.

Best regards,
Sean Calderon

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Corn Shipment from Paris to Prince Rupert
email_chain.body:
Dear Sean,

Thank you for the update. We agree to the revised rate of €70 per MT for the EXPRESS ROME. Please proceed with the necessary arrangements and send us the cp for review.

Best regards,
Karla Price

Sean Calderon

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Firm Offer: SEASPAN THAMES for Rice Cargo from Langedrag to Sharjah Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Maldonado,

We are pleased to offer the vessel SEASPAN THAMES (DWT: 115304, LOA: 337m) for your consideration to transport 4660MT of rice from Langedrag to Sharjah Anch on FOB terms. The vessel is currently open and can meet a laycan of 15-20 March 2023.

The starting freight rate is €30.44 per metric ton. Demurrage rate is set at $15,000 per day, pro rata. Loading rate is 5,000 MT per weather working day (wwd), and discharging rate is 4,500 MT per wwd.

Please note that the vessel is equipped with four cranes, which should expedite loading and discharging operations. Additionally, we’ve received reports of favorable weather conditions in Langedrag, which should minimize delays.

Kindly confirm your interest at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Adriana García
Global Maritime Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Firm Offer: SEASPAN THAMES for Rice Cargo from Langedrag to Sharjah Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. García,

Thank you for your offer. While the vessel specifications are suitable, the freight rate of €30.44 seems high compared to current market levels. Could you kindly revise the rate to a more competitive figure? Additionally, could you confirm if the vessel has a valid Suez Canal transit certificate?

We are also considering another vessel, so a prompt response would be appreciated.

Best regards,
Marcos Maldonado

email_chain.subject: Re: Revised Offer for SEASPAN THAMES
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Maldonado,

Thank you for your prompt response. We understand your concerns regarding the freight rate. After reviewing market conditions, we can offer a revised rate of €29.75 per metric ton. The SEASPAN THAMES does indeed possess a valid Suez Canal transit certificate, which should facilitate smooth passage if required.

On a side note, we’ve heard that Sharjah Anchorage is experiencing slight congestion due to increased traffic, but this should not significantly impact your discharge schedule.

Please let us know if this revised rate works for you, and we can proceed with finalizing the fixture.

Best regards,
Adriana García
Global Maritime Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Revised Offer for SEASPAN THAMES
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. García,

Thank you for the revised rate. While it is more competitive, we are still evaluating other options. Could you confirm if the laycan window of 15-20 March is still firm? Additionally, are there any additional port charges or fees we should be aware of at Sharjah Anch?

We will revert with a final decision by tomorrow.

Best regards,
Marcos Maldonado

email_chain.subject: Re: Laycan and Port Charges Clarification
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Maldonado,

The laycan window of 15-20 March remains firm, and we have not received any conflicting commitments for the vessel. Regarding port charges at Sharjah Anch, the standard anchorage fees apply, which are approximately $5,000 per day. These are typically borne by the charterer unless otherwise agreed.

We also wanted to mention that the SEASPAN THAMES recently underwent a routine inspection in Singapore, and all certifications are up to date. This should provide additional assurance regarding the vessel’s condition.

Looking forward to your final decision.

Best regards,
Adriana García
Global Maritime Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Decision on SEASPAN THAMES
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. García,

After careful consideration, we have decided to proceed with another vessel that better aligns with our budget and schedule. We appreciate your efforts and the detailed information provided. Should our requirements change in the future, we will certainly reach out.

Thank you for your time and understanding.

Best regards,
Marcos Maldonado

Best regards,
Jonathan

Thanks for getting back. I can bring the rate down to €69.00 per MT, but that’s the best I can do. The MSC NEW YORK is indeed equipped with OWS, so no worries there.

I’ll get the B/L and manifests over to you by EOD today. As for the laycan, I can push it to 27th-31st Dec, but we’ll need to confirm stem dates ASAP to avoid any delays.

Let me know if this works for you, and I’ll get the paperwork rolling.

Benjamin

Regarding the rumors, I have not heard of any recent bookings by competitors for this route. However, I will keep you updated if I receive any information.

Judy Payne

Annie

email_chain.body:

I understand your concern about the rate. After reviewing the market, I can offer a revised rate of AUD57.50 per MT. The demurrage rate for GOLDEN COMFORT is USD 25,000 per day. Please note that this rate is competitive given the vessel's specifications and current market conditions.

Global Maritime Brokers

Debbie Cabrera
Global Maritime Brokers

Diego Bailey
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil from Songmen to Zhangzhou

Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil from Songmen to Zhangzhou

Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Corn Shipment from St Petersburg to Jiangyin
email_chain.body:

Thank you for your inquiry. We are pleased to offer the following options:

1. Vessel: GUANG LI HAI (DWT: 207241, LOA: 300m)
   Freight: Low 50s USD/MT
   Laycan: 15-20 October
   Demurrage: USD 15,000 per day

2. Vessel: COSTA FORTUNA (DWT: 8200, LOA: 272m)
   Freight: Mid 50s USD/MT
   Laycan: 18-23 October
   Demurrage: USD 12,000 per day

Please let us know your preference so we can proceed accordingly.

Casey Ross

email_chain.body:

Let me know if this works for you, or if you’d like to explore alternate routes.

Roy

Let me know if this works, and we can lock in the laycan.

Best regards,
Roy

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore FOB Recalada to Nantong - Final Confirmation

email_chain.subject: Market Update: Sugar Freight Rates and Vessel Availability

I hope this email finds you well. I wanted to provide you with a quick update on the current market conditions for sugar shipments from Musaffah to Alamitos Bay.

Currently, we are seeing freight rates around €92.75 per metric ton for a cargo size of 8082MT. The vessel MEIN SCHIFF 3, with a DWT of 7900 and LOA of 293m, is available for this route. The laycan is set for 25-30 September, and the loading window is quite flexible.

Please let me know if you have any questions or if you would like to proceed with this option.

Lori Delgado
Seaway Commercial Brokers

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Shirley Meza

email_chain.subject: Re: Revised Quote and Demurrage Rate
email_chain.body:

Thank you for your prompt response. I understand your concern regarding the rate. After reviewing the market conditions again, I can offer a revised rate of €90.50 per metric ton. The demurrage rate for MEIN SCHIFF 3 is $12,000 per day.

Lori Delgado
Seaway Commercial Brokers

email_chain.subject: Market Update: Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Richardson,

I hope this email finds you well. I wanted to provide you with a quick update on the current market conditions for wheat shipments from Newport to Terneuzen. Freight rates are currently hovering around AUD47 per metric ton, with limited vessel availability due to high demand.

The CAPE CORMORANT, a vessel with a DWT of 181,500 and an LOA of 292m, is currently available and could be a suitable option for your cargo of 1,307MT. The laycan window is tight, so I recommend acting swiftly if this aligns with your requirements.

Please let me know if you would like to proceed or if you need any further details.

Best regards,
Eli Ray
Anderson Shipping Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Eli,

Thank you for the update. The rate of AUD47 seems a bit high given the current market conditions. Could you please clarify if this rate includes demurrage and what the laytime window would be for loading and discharge?

Additionally, could you confirm the stem date and any potential delays at Newport?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Erick Richardson

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Richardson,

Thank you for your prompt response. The AUD47 rate does not include demurrage, which is set at USD 12,000 per day pro rata. The laytime for loading and discharge is 72 hours each, with a laycan window of 10-15 June.

Regarding the stem date, we anticipate the vessel will be ready to load by 10 June, barring any unforeseen delays at Newport. The loading window is currently clear, but we recommend confirming closer to the date.

Please let me know if you would like to proceed or if you have any further questions.

Best regards,
Eli Ray
Anderson Shipping Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Eli,

Thank you for the clarification. Given the current market, I would like to propose a counteroffer of AUD45 per metric ton. Additionally, could you confirm the demurrage rate and laytime details in writing?

Also, please confirm if the vessel is NYPE compliant and if there are any additional charges we should be aware of.

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Erick Richardson

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Richardson,

Thank you for your counteroffer. After reviewing the market conditions, we can agree to a rate of AUD45 per metric ton. The demurrage rate remains at USD 12,000 per day pro rata, and the laytime is 72 hours each for loading and discharge.

The CAPE CORMORANT is NYPE compliant, and there are no additional charges beyond the agreed terms. I will send you a formal confirmation with all details shortly.

Please confirm your acceptance of these terms at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Eli Ray
Anderson Shipping Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Eli,

Thank you for your prompt response. I accept the terms as outlined. Please proceed with the formal confirmation and ensure that all details, including the laycan window and demurrage rate, are clearly stated.

Additionally, could you provide an update on the vessel's current position and estimated time of arrival at Newport?

Best regards,
Erick Richardson

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Richardson,

Thank you for your confirmation. I have attached the formal charter party agreement for your review and signature. The laycan window is confirmed for 10-15 June, with a demurrage rate of USD 12,000 per day pro rata.

The CAPE CORMORANT is currently en route to Newport and is expected to arrive on 9 June, weather permitting. I will keep you updated on any changes to the ETA.

Please sign and return the agreement at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Eli Ray
Anderson Shipping Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Eli,

Thank you for the agreement. I have reviewed and signed the document, which I am attaching to this email. Please confirm receipt and let me know if there are any further steps required from our side.

Looking forward to the successful completion of this shipment.

Best regards,
Erick Richardson

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Richardson,

Thank you for returning the signed agreement. I confirm receipt and will proceed with the necessary arrangements. I will keep you updated on the vessel's progress and any relevant developments.

Should you have any further questions or require additional information, please do not hesitate to contact me.

Best regards,
Eli Ray
Anderson Shipping Brokers

Global Maritime Brokers

Best regards,
Kristin Munoz
Global Maritime Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipment Inquiry - YM WHOLESOME

Silvia Soto

email_chain.subject: Coal Shipping Inquiry - STAR OPHELIA
email_chain.body:

We have vessel STAR OPHELIA (DWT 180716, LOA 292m) available for coal shipment from Mercury to Tanjung Pelepas Anch. Cargo size 9368MT, DDP terms. Starting freight quote €69/MT. Laycan 10-15 Oct. Please confirm interest.

Ed Aguilar

Thank you for your reply. €65/MT is too low. Best we can do is €67/MT with prepayment. Demurrage rate $15,000/day. Loading window 12-14 Oct. Please confirm.

Best regards,
Lee Cox

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipping Inquiry - STAR OPHELIA

€67/MT acceptable if demurrage reduced to $14,000/day. We will proceed with 50% prepayment. Please confirm final terms and provide proforma invoice.

Ed

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipping Inquiry - STAR OPHELIA

Agreed. €67/MT, demurrage $14,000/day. Proforma invoice attached. Laycan 12-14 Oct. Please confirm receipt and prepayment details.

Best regards,
Lee Cox

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipping Inquiry - STAR OPHELIA

Best,
Ed

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipping Inquiry - STAR OPHELIA

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipping Inquiry - STAR OPHELIA

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipping Inquiry - STAR OPHELIA

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipping Inquiry - STAR OPHELIA

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Vessel Needed for Rice Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Anderson,

We urgently require a vessel for a shipment of 12044MT rice from Langedrag to Humen on FOB terms. Due to disruptions in our supply chain, we need to secure a vessel as soon as possible. Please provide a freight quote and vessel details at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Tom Ochoa
Global Charter Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Vessel Needed for Rice Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ochoa,

Thank you for your inquiry. We can offer the vessel MALINDI, DWT 177987, LOA 292m, for your shipment. The starting freight quote is EUR56.63 per MT. Please note that due to the urgency, we may need to adjust the rate slightly. The laycan is 28/12/2008 - 02/01/2009. Let us know if this works for you.

Kind regards,
Connie Anderson
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Vessel Needed for Rice Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Anderson,

Thank you for the prompt response. The laycan window is acceptable, but we find the freight rate a bit high. Could you consider a rate closer to EUR54.00 per MT? Also, could you confirm the demurrage rate per day?

Best regards,
Tom Ochoa
Global Charter Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Vessel Needed for Rice Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ochoa,

We understand your concern regarding the rate. Considering the urgency and our long-standing relationship, we can adjust the freight rate to EUR55.00 per MT. The demurrage rate is USD12,000 per day. Please confirm your acceptance so we can proceed with the fixture.

Kind regards,
Connie Anderson
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Vessel Needed for Rice Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Anderson,

We accept the adjusted freight rate of EUR55.00 per MT and the demurrage rate of USD12,000 per day. Please proceed with the fixture for the vessel MALINDI with the laycan 28/12/2008 - 02/01/2009. We will send the necessary documentation shortly.

Best regards,
Tom Ochoa
Global Charter Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Rate Inquiry for Rice Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Guillermo,

I hope this email finds you well. We are looking to charter a vessel for a shipment of 1476MT of rice from Port Hamble to Xiuyu on DDP terms. Could you provide us with an estimated freight rate for this route? Additionally, if you have any suitable vessels in mind, please share their details.

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Marilyn Palmer

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Inquiry for Rice Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Marilyn,

Thank you for your inquiry. For the shipment of 1476MT of rice from Port Hamble to Xiuyu on DDP terms, we can offer a freight rate of €61.84 per metric ton. The vessel we have in mind is the DHT OPAL, with a DWT of 320105 and an LOA of 333m. The laycan is tentatively set for 15-20 October, subject to confirmation.

Please let us know if this works for you or if you need further details.

Best regards,
Guillermo Fuentes

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Inquiry for Rice Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Guillermo,

Thank you for the prompt response. The rate of €61.84 seems reasonable, but could you confirm the laycan and the demurrage rate per day? Also, are there any additional charges we should be aware of?

Looking forward to your clarification.

Best regards,
Marilyn Palmer

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Inquiry for Rice Shipment - Correction
email_chain.body:
Dear Marilyn,

Apologies for the oversight in my previous email. The correct laycan for the DHT OPAL is 18-23 October. The demurrage rate is €12,000 per day. There are no additional charges beyond the freight rate and demurrage.

Please confirm if this aligns with your requirements.

Best regards,
Guillermo Fuentes

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Inquiry for Rice Shipment - Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Guillermo,

Thank you for the clarification. The laycan of 18-23 October and the demurrage rate of €12,000 per day are acceptable. Please proceed with the booking for the DHT OPAL at the agreed rate of €61.84 per metric ton.

Looking forward to the confirmation.

Best regards,
Marilyn Palmer

email_chain.subject: Market Update: Soybeans Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Carlos,

I hope this email finds you well. I wanted to provide you with a quick update on the current market conditions for Soybeans shipping from Sydney to Beihai. The current freight rate is hovering around AUD53 per metric ton. Vessel availability is tight, but we have the MARINER OF THE SEAS (DWT: 9616, LOA: 311m) potentially available for your cargo size of 8245MT. The laycan is flexible, but we need to confirm soon to secure the vessel.

Please let me know your thoughts.

Best regards,
Megan Montoya
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Soybeans Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Megan,

Thanks for the update. AUD53 seems a bit high given the current market. Could you please check if there's any room for negotiation on the rate? Also, could you confirm the loading window and the demurrage rate per day for the MARINER OF THE SEAS?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best,
Carlos

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Soybeans Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Carlos,

Thank you for your prompt response. I understand your concern regarding the rate. After reviewing the market conditions, I can offer a revised rate of AUD50 per metric ton. The loading window is between 15th to 20th January, and the demurrage rate is USD12,000 per day.

Please let me know if this works for you.

Best regards,
Megan Montoya
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Soybeans Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Megan,

AUD50 sounds more reasonable. However, could we push the loading window to 18th to 23rd January? Also, is there any flexibility on the demurrage rate?

Best,
Carlos

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Soybeans Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Carlos,

I can confirm the loading window adjustment to 18th to 23rd January. Regarding the demurrage rate, the best I can do is USD11,500 per day.

Please confirm if these terms are acceptable.

Best regards,
Megan Montoya
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Soybeans Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Megan,

Thank you for the adjustments. We agree to the terms: AUD50 per metric ton, loading window 18th to 23rd January, and demurrage rate of USD11,500 per day. Please proceed with securing the MARINER OF THE SEAS.

Best,
Carlos

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Soybeans Freight Rates and Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Carlos,

Great news! The MARINER OF THE SEAS has been secured for your cargo. I will send over the finalized charter party agreement shortly.

Thank you for your business.

Best regards,
Megan Montoya
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Palm Oil Shipment from Fourchon to Napoli

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Palm Oil Shipment from Fourchon to Napoli

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Palm Oil Shipment from Fourchon to Napoli
