email_chain.subject: Freight Offer for Aluminum Shipment - Laizhou to Batu Ampar
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Rosas,

We are pleased to offer freight for your shipment of 9223MT Aluminum from Laizhou to Batu Ampar under DAP terms. The vessel we propose is the ONAIZA, with a DWT of 121939 and LOA of 315m. The starting freight quote is AUD53 per metric ton.

Please note that this rate is subject to a Bunker Adjustment Factor (BAF) due to recent increases in fuel costs. We can discuss this further if you are interested in proceeding.

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Ariel Vasquez
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Aluminum Shipment - Laizhou to Batu Ampar
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vasquez,

Thank you for your prompt offer. Could you please clarify the laycan and the loading window for this shipment? Additionally, we would like to understand the demurrage rate per day in case of delays.

Regarding the BAF, could you provide a numeric value or a range for the surcharge?

Looking forward to your detailed response.

Best regards,
Sam Rosas
Cargo Logistics

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Aluminum Shipment - Laizhou to Batu Ampar
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Rosas,

Thank you for your inquiries. The laycan for the ONAIZA is set between 25th and 30th June, with a loading window of 72 hours. The demurrage rate is USD 12,000 per day.

Regarding the BAF, we propose an additional AUD 2.50 per metric ton to account for the current fuel price volatility. This brings the adjusted freight rate to AUD 55.50 per metric ton.

Please let us know if these terms are acceptable or if you have any further questions.

Best regards,
Ariel Vasquez
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Aluminum Shipment - Laizhou to Batu Ampar
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vasquez,

Thank you for the detailed information. The laycan and loading window are acceptable. However, we find the adjusted freight rate of AUD 55.50 per metric ton to be on the higher side. Could you consider revising the rate to AUD 54.00 per metric ton, inclusive of the BAF?

Looking forward to your revised offer.

Best regards,
Sam Rosas
Cargo Logistics

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Aluminum Shipment - Laizhou to Batu Ampar
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Rosas,

We appreciate your counteroffer. After careful consideration, we can adjust the freight rate to AUD 54.50 per metric ton, inclusive of the BAF. This rate reflects the current market conditions and ensures the quality of service you expect.

Please confirm your acceptance so we can proceed with the necessary arrangements.

Best regards,
Ariel Vasquez
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Aluminum Shipment - Laizhou to Batu Ampar
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vasquez,

Thank you for the revised offer. We accept the adjusted freight rate of AUD 54.50 per metric ton, inclusive of the BAF. Please proceed with the necessary arrangements and provide us with the final confirmation and documentation.

Looking forward to a successful shipment.

Best regards,
Sam Rosas
Cargo Logistics

email_chain.subject: Final Confirmation for Aluminum Shipment - Laizhou to Batu Ampar
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Rosas,

We are pleased to confirm the final arrangements for your shipment of 9223MT Aluminum from Laizhou to Batu Ampar. The freight rate is set at AUD 54.50 per metric ton, inclusive of the BAF. The laycan remains between 25th and 30th June, with a loading window of 72 hours.

Please find attached the final contract and necessary documentation for your review and signature. Once signed, kindly return the documents at your earliest convenience.

Thank you for choosing Oceanic Trade Services. We look forward to a successful partnership.

Best regards,
Ariel Vasquez
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Final Confirmation for Aluminum Shipment - Laizhou to Batu Ampar
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vasquez,

Thank you for the final confirmation and documentation. We have reviewed and signed the contract, which is attached to this email. Please proceed with the shipment as per the agreed terms.

We appreciate your professionalism and look forward to a smooth operation.

Best regards,
Sam Rosas
Cargo Logistics

email_chain.subject: Re: Final Confirmation for Aluminum Shipment - Laizhou to Batu Ampar
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Wheat Shipment - Napoli to Plymouth
email_chain.body:
Dear Adriana,

I hope this email finds you well. We have reviewed your requirements for the shipment of 4634MT of Wheat from Napoli to Plymouth on a DAP basis. We are pleased to offer the vessel EVER DEVOTION (DWT: 180125, LOA: 295m) for this voyage.

The initial freight quote is USD36.01 per metric ton. The laycan window is set for 2025-08-10 to 2025-08-15, with a loading window of 72 hours. The demurrage rate is set at USD12,500 per day, pro rata.

Please let us know if this works for you or if you have any specific conditions or counteroffers.

Best regards,
Zach Wilson
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Wheat Shipment - Napoli to Plymouth
email_chain.body:
Hi Zach,

Thank you for the prompt response and the details provided. We have reviewed the offer and would like to discuss the freight rate further. Given that our cargo insurance terms significantly lower the vessel’s exposure, we were expecting a corresponding discount on the freight rate.

Could you consider revising the rate to USD34.50 per metric ton? Additionally, could you confirm the laytime details and any potential adjustments to the demurrage rate?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Adriana George

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Wheat Shipment - Napoli to Plymouth
email_chain.body:
Dear Adriana,

Thank you for your feedback. We understand your position regarding the cargo insurance terms and the reduced risk exposure. After careful consideration, we are willing to adjust the freight rate to USD35.25 per metric ton.

Regarding the laytime, it remains as previously stated: 72 hours for loading, with the laycan window from 2025-08-10 to 2025-08-15. The demurrage rate will stay at USD12,500 per day, pro rata, as this is standard for this type of shipment.

Please confirm if this revised rate is acceptable to you so we can proceed with the necessary arrangements.

Best regards,
Zach Wilson
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Freight Offer for Sugar Cargo - Anacortes to Tarragona
email_chain.body:
Dear Tanya,

I hope this email finds you well. We have a firm offer for the shipment of 4227MT of sugar from Anacortes to Tarragona on a CIF basis. The vessel we are proposing is the GASLOG GENEVA, with a DWT of 87760 and an LOA of 291m. The laycan is set for November 20-25, 2006.

The starting freight quote is in the mid 70s (USD). Please note that due to the high-risk nature of the route, a war risk premium and piracy surcharge will apply. We are looking at an additional $5 per MT for these risks.

Let me know your thoughts, and we can proceed accordingly.

Best regards,
Tiffany Morgan
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar Cargo - Anacortes to Tarragona
email_chain.body:
Hi Tiffany,

Thank you for the offer. The rate seems a bit on the higher side, especially with the additional surcharges. Could you clarify if the war risk and piracy surcharges are fixed or if there's any room for negotiation?

Also, could you confirm the demurrage rate per day in case of delays?

Looking forward to your response.

Best,
Tanya Cortez

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar Cargo - Anacortes to Tarragona
email_chain.body:
Dear Tanya,

Thank you for your prompt response. The war risk and piracy surcharges are generally fixed due to the current market conditions, but I can look into a slight reduction if we can finalize the deal soon.

The demurrage rate is set at $15,000 per day, pro rata. The loading window is tight, so we aim to minimize any delays.

Let me know if this works for you, or if you have any other concerns.

Best regards,
Tiffany Morgan
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar Cargo - Anacortes to Tarragona
email_chain.body:
Hi Tiffany,

Thanks for the clarification. Considering the tight loading window and the additional surcharges, could we aim for a freight rate in the low 70s? This would help us manage the overall costs better.

Also, could you confirm the stem dates and any potential for early loading?

Best,
Tanya Cortez

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar Cargo - Anacortes to Tarragona
email_chain.body:
Dear Tanya,

I understand your concerns regarding the rate. After discussing with the owners, we can offer a revised freight rate of $72 per MT, inclusive of the war risk and piracy surcharges. This is a competitive rate given the current market and the vessel's specifications.

The stem dates are firm for November 20-25, with a possibility of early loading if the vessel arrives ahead of schedule. However, this is subject to port availability.

Please let me know if this revised offer is acceptable, and we can proceed with the fixture.

Best regards,
Tiffany Morgan
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar Cargo - Anacortes to Tarragona
email_chain.body:
Hi Tiffany,

The revised rate of $72 per MT is more in line with our expectations. We agree to proceed with this offer. Please confirm the laycan and ensure that all necessary documentation is prepared for a smooth loading process.

Also, could you provide a final confirmation on the demurrage rate and any other potential charges we should be aware of?

Best,
Tanya Cortez

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar Cargo - Anacortes to Tarragona
email_chain.body:
Dear Tanya,

Great to hear that the revised rate works for you. The laycan remains November 20-25, and I will ensure all documentation is in order for a smooth loading process.

The demurrage rate is confirmed at $15,000 per day, pro rata. There are no other additional charges beyond what we've discussed.

I will send over the fixture recap shortly for your review and signature.

Best regards,
Tiffany Morgan
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar Cargo - Anacortes to Tarragona
email_chain.body:
Hi Tiffany,

Thank you for the prompt follow-up. We will review the fixture recap as soon as it arrives and proceed with the necessary signatures.

Looking forward to a successful shipment.

Best,
Tanya Cortez

Armando Cohen
Seaway Commercial Brokers

email_chain.subject: Freight Offer for Corn Cargo - SEAUNITY
email_chain.body:
Dear Dana,

We are pleased to offer the vessel SEAUNITY (DWT: 181360, LOA: 292m) for your corn cargo of 1193MT from Flisvos to Murmansk on CIF terms. The freight rate is EUR43 per metric ton.

Laycan is set for 20-25/09/2011, with a loading window of 72 hours. Demurrage rate is USD 12,000 per day, pro rata.

Please let us know if this works for you or if you need further details.

Best regards,
Brooke Graham
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Corn Cargo - SEAUNITY
email_chain.body:
Hi Brooke,

Thanks for the offer. I noticed that both Flisvos and Murmansk have relatively low port fees. Given this, could we revisit the freight rate? Perhaps EUR40 per MT?

Also, could you confirm the stem dates and any additional charges?

Best,
Dana

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Corn Cargo - SEAUNITY
email_chain.body:
Dear Dana,

Thank you for your prompt response. While we acknowledge the lower port fees, EUR43 remains a competitive rate considering the vessel's specifications and current market conditions. However, we can offer a slight adjustment to EUR42 per MT.

The stem dates are confirmed for 20-25/09/2011, with no additional charges beyond the demurrage rate of USD 12,000 per day.

Let us know if this revised rate is acceptable.

Best regards,
Brooke Graham
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Corn Cargo - SEAUNITY
email_chain.body:
Hi Brooke,

Thanks for the revised offer. We can agree to EUR42 per MT, provided the laycan remains firm at 20-25/09/2011. Please confirm the final details and send over the contract for review.

Best,
Dana

email_chain.subject: Fwd: Final Contract for Corn Cargo - SEAUNITY
email_chain.body:
Dear Dana,

Thank you for your confirmation. Attached is the final contract for your review. The agreed freight rate is EUR42 per MT, with laycan 20-25/09/2011 and demurrage at USD 12,000 per day.

Please sign and return at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Brooke Graham
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Cotton Shipment from Changshu to Varna
email_chain.body:
Dear Felipe,

I hope this email finds you well. We are looking to charter a vessel for the shipment of 884MT of cotton from Changshu to Varna under DAP terms. Could you please provide a freight quote and suggest a suitable vessel? We are particularly concerned about the vessel's age and draft, as we need to ensure smooth loading and discharge operations.

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Pedro Khan

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Cotton Shipment from Changshu to Varna
email_chain.body:
Dear Pedro,

Thank you for your inquiry. I am pleased to offer you a freight rate of EUR71.83 per MT for the shipment of 884MT of cotton from Changshu to Varna. I recommend the vessel JAHAM, which has a DWT of 319430 and an LOA of 332m. This vessel is well-suited for your cargo and has a good track record for handling similar shipments.

Regarding your concerns about the vessel's age and draft, I can assure you that JAHAM is in excellent condition and has a draft that is compatible with both Changshu and Varna ports. The laycan for this vessel is 10-15 September, and we can discuss the loading window and demurrage rate per day if you are interested.

Please let me know if you have any further questions or if you would like to proceed with this offer.

Best regards,
Felipe Richards
Anderson Shipping Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Cotton Shipment from Changshu to Varna
email_chain.body:
Dear Felipe,

Thank you for your prompt response and the detailed information. We are considering your offer but would like to negotiate the freight rate. Given the current market conditions, we believe a rate of EUR68.50 per MT would be more appropriate. Could you please confirm if this is acceptable?

Additionally, could you provide more details on the demurrage rate per day and the loading window?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Pedro Khan

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Cotton Shipment from Changshu to Varna
email_chain.body:
Dear Pedro,

Thank you for your counteroffer. After reviewing the current market conditions, I can confirm a revised freight rate of EUR68.50 per MT for your shipment. The demurrage rate per day is set at EUR12,000, and the loading window is 48 hours atutc.

Please let me know if these terms are acceptable to you, and we can proceed with the necessary arrangements.

Best regards,
Felipe Richards
Anderson Shipping Brokers

Our initial freight quote is $74 per metric ton. I should also mention that we have received interest from another charterer, so I recommend acting swiftly if this fits your schedule.

Melanie Silva
Anderson Shipping Brokers

Also, could you confirm the demurrage rate per day and the loading window?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best,
Laurie

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipping Opportunity - NETADOLA
email_chain.body:
Dear Laurie,

Thank you for your prompt response. Considering our long-standing relationship, I can offer a revised rate of $72 per metric ton. The demurrage rate is set at $15,000 per day, pro rata, and the loading window is 72 hours, weather permitting.

Please note that this offer is valid until close of business today due to the high demand for this vessel.

Best regards,
Melanie Silva
Anderson Shipping Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipping Opportunity - NETADOLA
email_chain.body:
Hi Melanie,

We accept your revised offer of $72 per metric ton. Please proceed with the necessary arrangements and send over the charter party agreement for review.

Thank you for your flexibility.

Best,
Laurie

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Soybeans from Lorient to Shenzhen
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Miller,

We are pleased to provide you with a freight quote for the shipment of 7,229 MT of soybeans from Lorient to Shenzhen on the vessel MEYNELL (DWT: 185,767, LOA: 292m).

The initial freight rate is €75.29 per metric ton, DDP terms. The laycan is set for 20-25 September 2009, with a loading window of 72 hours. Demurrage rate is €12,500 per day.

Please let us know if this works for you or if you require any further details.

Best regards,
Alfonso Robinson
Anderson Shipping Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Soybeans from Lorient to Shenzhen
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Robinson,

Thank you for the quote. However, the rate of €75.29 seems quite high compared to current market trends. We are also exploring alternative transport modes such as rail and road, which could be more cost-effective.

Could you please reconsider the rate or provide a more competitive offer?

Best regards,
Gina Miller
Global Charterers

email_chain.subject: Revised Freight Quote for Soybeans from Lorient to Shenzhen
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Miller,

Thank you for your feedback. We understand your concerns regarding the rate. After reviewing the market conditions, we are able to offer a revised freight rate of €72.50 per metric ton, DDP terms.

The laycan and loading window remain unchanged. We hope this revised rate is more in line with your expectations.

Please confirm your acceptance at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Alfonso Robinson
Anderson Shipping Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Revised Freight Quote for Soybeans from Lorient to Shenzhen
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Robinson,

Thank you for the revised quote. We appreciate the adjustment, but we are still finding it challenging to justify the rate given the current market conditions. Could you please consider a further reduction to €70.00 per metric ton?

We are eager to finalize this shipment and would appreciate your prompt response.

Best regards,
Gina Miller
Global Charterers

email_chain.subject: Final Freight Quote for Soybeans from Lorient to Shenzhen
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Miller,

After careful consideration, we are pleased to offer a final freight rate of €70.50 per metric ton, DDP terms. This is our best and final offer, taking into account the current market conditions and your valued business.

The laycan remains 20-25 September 2009, with a loading window of 72 hours. Demurrage rate is €12,500 per day.

Please confirm your acceptance so we can proceed with the necessary arrangements.

Best regards,

Thanks for reaching out. I’ve got the HONG KONG SPIRIT available for your cargo. She’s a 318,473 DWT vessel with an LOA of 333m, so plenty of space for your 5566MT. Freight quote is USD68.98 per MT. Laycan 20-25 June works, but I’d suggest tightening it to 22-24 June to avoid congestion at Lagos Anch.

Let me know your thoughts.

Cheers,
Brett

Best,
Peter

email_chain.body:

Understood. I can bring the rate down to USD66.50 per MT. Demurrage is $15,000 per day, pro rata. As for the laycan, I’ll check with the owner, but 20-25 June should be doable. Let me know if this works for you.

Cheers,
Brett

Best,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Rice Shipment from Marsamxett to Lagos Anch
email_chain.body:

Great! Laycan confirmed for 20-25 June. The HONG KONG SPIRIT will be ready for loading by the 20th. Damfordet details will follow shortly. Just to confirm, the demurrage rate is $15,000 per day, ha.

Let me know if you need anything else.

Cheers,
Brett

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Rice Shipment from Marsamxett to Lagos Anch

Perfect. Please send over the damfordet as soon as possible. We’ll proceed with the booking once we have it.

Best,
Peter

Cheers,
Brett

email_chain.subject: Iron Ore Shipment - Puerto Montt to Penglai

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Sugar Shipment from Den Helder to Portland Or
email_chain.body:
Dear Theresa,

I hope this email finds you well. We are looking to charter a vessel for a shipment of 3717MT of sugar from Den Helder to Portland Or. We are initially considering FOB terms. Could you please provide a freight quote and suggest a suitable vessel for this cargo?

Looking forward to your prompt response.

Best regards,
Victor Hawkins

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Sugar Shipment from Den Helder to Portland Or
email_chain.body:
Dear Victor,

Thank you for your inquiry. I am pleased to inform you that we can offer the vessel MARIGO P, which has a DWT of 179218 and an LOA of 292m, for your shipment. The vessel is well-suited for your cargo size and route.

For FOB terms, the starting freight quote is USD74 per metric ton. Please note that this rate includes all standard handling and loading charges at Den Helder. The laycan for this vessel is between 10th and 15th December 2010.

Should you have any further questions or require additional details, please do not hesitate to contact me.

Best regards,
Theresa Green
Global Maritime Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Sugar Shipment from Den Helder to Portland Or
email_chain.body:
Dear Theresa,

Thank you for the prompt response and the details provided. After reviewing, we are considering switching to CIF terms instead of FOB. Could you please update the freight quote and responsibilities accordingly?

Additionally, could you confirm the demurrage rate per day for the MARIGO P?

Looking forward to your updated quote.

Best regards,
Victor Hawkins

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Sugar Shipment from Den Helder to Portland Or - Updated Quote
email_chain.body:
Dear Victor,

Thank you for your update. Switching to CIF terms will adjust the freight quote to USD78 per metric ton, which now includes insurance and freight to Portland Or. The demurrage rate for the MARIGO P is USD15,000 per day.

Please let me know if this works for you or if you need any further adjustments.

Best regards,
Theresa Green
Global Maritime Brokers

Freight rate is quoted at €94.11 per MT. Laycan is proposed for 20-25 November. Loading window is 3 days, and demurrage rate is set at €12,000 per day.

Best regards,
Jan Aguilar
Oceanic Trade Services

Thanks for the offer. The cargo is upgraded sugar, very easy to handle and low-risk. Given this, we believe a reduced freight rate is justified. Could you consider €90.00 per MT?

Also, can you confirm if the vessel is SOC? We prefer to avoid additional handling charges.

Looking forward to your reply.

Best,
Blake Quintero

email_chain.body:
Dear Blake,

Thank you for your prompt response. We understand your cargo is upgraded sugar, but considering the current market conditions and the vessel's specifications, the best we can offer is €92.50 per MT.

Yes, the vessel is SOC, so no additional handling charges will apply. Laycan remains 20-25 November, and loading window is 3 days. Demurrage rate is €12,000 per day.

Please confirm if this works for you.

Best regards,
Jan Aguilar
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar Cargo - NAVIOS UNISON
email_chain.body:

Best,
Blake Quintero

email_chain.subject: Iron Ore Shipment Inquiry - Alamitos Bay to Mumbai
email_chain.body:
Dear Bill,

I hope this email finds you well. We are looking to charter a vessel for a shipment of 9141MT of iron ore from Alamitos Bay to Mumbai on DDP terms. I’ve heard rumors that a competitor might have already booked the NEW PROSPECT for a similar route. Could you confirm if this vessel is still available and provide a freight quote?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Margaret Quintero
Global Cargo Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Shipment Inquiry - Alamitos Bay to Mumbai
email_chain.body:
Dear Margaret,

Thank you for your inquiry. I can confirm that the NEW PROSPECT (DWT: 297934, LOA: 330m) is indeed available for your shipment. The vessel is well-suited for your cargo size and route. I can offer a freight rate of €77.32 per metric ton on DDP terms. The laycan window is flexible, but I recommend securing a loading window between 25th and 30th September to avoid congestion at Alamitos Bay.

Let me know if this works for you or if you’d like to discuss further.

Best regards,
Bill Acevedo
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Shipment Inquiry - Alamitos Bay to Mumbai
email_chain.body:
Dear Bill,

Thank you for the prompt response. The rate seems a bit high compared to market trends. Could you consider revising it to €75.00 per metric ton? Additionally, could you confirm the demurrage rate per day in case of delays?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Margaret Quintero
Global Cargo Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Shipment Inquiry - Alamitos Bay to Mumbai
email_chain.body:
Dear Margaret,

I appreciate your feedback on the rate. Given our long-standing relationship, I can adjust the freight rate to €76.00 per metric ton. The demurrage rate is set at €15,000 per day, pro rata. I hope this revised offer aligns better with your expectations.

Please let me know if you’d like to proceed or if there are any other details you’d like to discuss.

Best regards,
Bill Acevedo
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Shipment Inquiry - Alamitos Bay to Mumbai
email_chain.body:
Dear Bill,

Thank you for the revised rate. We are almost there, but could you consider a final adjustment to €75.50 per metric ton? Also, could you confirm the laytime start and end dates?

Looking forward to your confirmation.

Best regards,
Margaret Quintero
Global Cargo Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Shipment Inquiry - Alamitos Bay to Mumbai
email_chain.body:
Dear Margaret,

I can agree to your proposed rate of €75.50 per metric ton. The laytime will commence on 25th September and end on 30th September. Please confirm if this works for you, and I’ll prepare the charter party agreement accordingly.

Best regards,
Bill Acevedo
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Shipment Inquiry - Alamitos Bay to Mumbai
email_chain.body:
Dear Bill,

Thank you for your flexibility. We agree to the terms: €75.50 per metric ton, laytime from 25th to 30th September, and a demurrage rate of €15,000 per day. Please proceed with the charter party agreement and share it for review.

Best regards,
Margaret Quintero
Global Cargo Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Fwd: Charter Party Agreement - Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Margaret,

As requested, I’ve attached the draft charter party agreement for your review. Please let me know if any amendments are needed. Once confirmed, we can proceed with the finalization.

Best regards,
Bill Acevedo
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Party Agreement - Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Bill,

The charter party agreement looks good. We’ve reviewed it and found no issues. Please proceed with the finalization. Let me know once everything is signed and confirmed.

Best regards,
Margaret Quintero
Global Cargo Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Party Agreement - Iron Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Margaret,

Great to hear that the agreement meets your expectations. I’ve finalized and signed the charter party. The vessel is now officially booked for your shipment. I’ll keep you updated on any developments regarding the loading schedule.

Thank you for your trust in Maritime Exchange Ltd.

Best regards,
Bill Acevedo
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Rice Shipment from Busan New Port to Van Isle
email_chain.body:

Thank you for your inquiry. We have the CAPE SHANGHAI available, which is well-suited for your cargo. The vessel has a DWT of 176460 and an LOA of 292m, ensuring ample space and stability for your shipment.

We can offer a freight rate of €85 per metric ton. The laycan window can be adjusted to July 15-18 to ensure timely loading. The demurrage rate is set at €15,000 per day.

Please let us know if this works for you or if you require any further details.

Best regards,
Thomas Peña

Additionally, could you confirm the stem details and any potential delays at the load port?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Anita Fuentes

email_chain.body:
Dear Anita,

Thank you for your feedback. After reviewing the market conditions, we can adjust the freight rate to €82 per metric ton. This rate is quite competitive given the current market.

Regarding the stem details, loading is expected to commence on July 15, with no anticipated delays at Busan New Port. We will ensure all necessary arrangements are in place for a smooth operation.

Please confirm your acceptance of the revised rate and the laycan window.

Best regards,
Thomas Peña

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Rice Shipment from Busan New Port to Van Isle

email_chain.subject: LNG CFR Rotterdam Maasvlakte to Huizhou - Initial Freight Quote
email_chain.body:
Dear Gustavo,

I hope this email finds you well. Following up on our recent discussion, I’m pleased to provide an initial freight quote for the LNG shipment from Rotterdam Maasvlakte to Huizhou.

Commodity: LNG
Cargo Size: 10,483 MT
Vessel: OLYMPIC LIFE (DWT: 318,676, LOA: 333m)
Incoterm: CFR
Freight Rate: USD 74.83 per MT

Please note that the laycan window is tentatively set for 25-30 July, subject to vessel availability. The demurrage rate is USD 25,000 per day, pro rata.

Additionally, I wanted to mention that Rotterdam Maasvlakte has recently implemented new port congestion measures due to increased traffic. This shouldn’t affect our timeline, but it’s worth keeping in mind.

Looking forward to your feedback.

Best regards,
Kelly Castaneda
Anderson Shipping Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG CFR Rotterdam Maasvlakte to Huizhou - Initial Freight Quote
email_chain.body:
Hi Kelly,

Thank you for the quote. Given the current economic slowdown and falling trade volumes, we believe the rate should reflect weaker demand. Could you reconsider the freight rate to better align with market conditions?

Also, could you confirm the stem dates for loading? We need to ensure the cargo is ready in time.

Best regards,
Gustavo García
EnergyCorp

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG CFR Rotterdam Maasvlakte to Huizhou - Revised Freight Quote
email_chain.body:
Dear Gustavo,

Thank you for your prompt response. I understand your concerns regarding the economic climate. After reviewing the market, we can offer a revised freight rate of USD 72.50 per MT.

Regarding the stem dates, the loading window remains 25-30 July. Please let us know if this works for you.

On a side note, I heard that Huizhou port is experiencing some delays due to typhoon season. While this shouldn’t impact our schedule, it’s something to monitor.

Looking forward to your confirmation.

Best regards,
Kelly Castaneda
Anderson Shipping Brokers

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG CFR Rotterdam Maasvlakte to Huizhou - Final Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi Kelly,

Thank you for the revised quote. We accept the rate of USD 72.50 per MT. Please proceed with the booking for the OLYMPIC LIFE, with the laycan window of 25-30 July.

Could you also confirm the demurrage rate and any additional terms? We’d like to finalize the details as soon as possible.

Best regards,
Gustavo García
EnergyCorp

Eduardo

Pamela

Thanks for your reply. EUR71 is competitive given current market, but I can do EUR69.50 if we finalize today. ATLANTIC SEA’s draft is 12.5m, which is within Oostende’s limits, and she’s equipped with dynamic positioning for mooring. Loading window is 48 hours, and demurrage is USD 25,000/day.

Eduardo

Pamela

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Cargo Offer - Jingtang to Oostende
email_chain.body:
Hi Pamela,

Laycan 29-31 Aug is confirmed. Demurrage is pro-rata, calculated per hour after the first 6 hours. Loading window remains 48 hours. Let me know if you need anything else.

Best,
Eduardo

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Cargo Offer - Jingtang to Oostende
email_chain.body:

Pamela

email_chain.subject: Fwd: Recap - LNG Cargo Jingtang to Oostende

Attached is the recap for your review. Key points:
- Vessel: ATLANTIC SEA
- Cargo: 11152MT LNG
- Laycan: 29-31 Aug
- Freight: EUR69.50
- Demurrage: USD 25,000/day (pro-rata)

Let me know if any changes are needed.

Best,
Eduardo

email_chain.subject: Re: Recap - LNG Cargo Jingtang to Oostende

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Corn Shipment from Amsterdam Anch to Antwerp Anch
email_chain.body:
Hi Ruben,

Hope you're doing well. We are looking to charter a vessel for a shipment of 1916MT of corn from Amsterdam Anch to Antwerp Anch on FOB terms. Could you please provide a freight quote and confirm the laycan window? Also, any details on the vessel you have in mind would be appreciated.

Best regards,
Brittany Hunt

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Corn Shipment from Amsterdam Anch to Antwerp Anch
email_chain.body:
Hi Brittany,

Thanks for your inquiry. We can offer the vessel MARIPERLA, DWT 179759, LOA 292m, for your shipment. The laycan window is 20-25 August. Freight rate is €118.55 per MT. Please let me know if this works for you.

Best regards,
Ruben Ramirez

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Corn Shipment from Amsterdam Anch to Antwerp Anch
email_chain.body:
Hi Ruben,

Thanks for the quick response. The laycan window is a bit tight for us. Is there any possibility to extend it to 18-27 August? Also, could you clarify if the freight rate includes demurrage and what the demurrage rate per day would be?

Best regards,
Brittany Hunt

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Corn Shipment from Amsterdam Anch to Antwerp Anch
email_chain.body:
Hi Brittany,

Apologies for the confusion earlier. The correct laycan window is 18-27 August. The freight rate of €118.55 per MT does not include demurrage. The demurrage rate is €15,000 per day. Please confirm if this works for you.

Best regards,
Ruben Ramirez

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Corn Shipment from Amsterdam Anch to Antwerp Anch
email_chain.body:
Hi Ruben,

Thank you for the clarification. The extended laycan window works for us. We agree to the freight rate of €118.55 per MT and the demurrage rate of €15,000 per day. Please proceed with the necessary arrangements.

Best regards,
Brittany Hunt

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Sugar Cargo - Qinhuangdao Anch to Hamriya
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Juarez,

We are pleased to provide you with a freight quote for your sugar cargo. Details are as follows:

- Commodity: Sugar
- Load Port: Qinhuangdao Anch
- Discharge Port: Hamriya
- Cargo Size: 3605MT
- Incoterm: DAP
- Vessel: CIC ROLACO (DWT: 175641, LOA: 292m)
- Freight Rate: $60.44 per MT

Please note that the laycan is set for 15-20 September. The loading window is 72 hours, and the demurrage rate is $12,000 per day.

We look forward to your confirmation.

Best regards,
Katie Vasquez
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Sugar Cargo - Qinhuangdao Anch to Hamriya
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Vasquez,

Thank you for your prompt response. We appreciate the details provided. However, considering the nature of the cargo (sugar is easy to handle and low-risk), we would like to negotiate a reduced freight rate. Could you consider a rate of $58.00 per MT?

Additionally, could you confirm the laytime and any potential delays at the discharge port?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Marc Juarez

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Sugar Cargo - Qinhuangdao Anch to Hamriya
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Juarez,

Thank you for your feedback. We understand your concerns regarding the cargo's nature. After reviewing, we can offer a revised freight rate of $59.00 per MT. This rate is competitive given the vessel's specifications and current market conditions.

Regarding laytime, it remains 72 hours, and we do not anticipate significant delays at Hamriya. However, we recommend confirming the stem details closer to the loading date.

Please let us know if this revised rate is acceptable.

Best regards,
Katie Vasquez
Oceanic Trade Services

Lucas López

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Final Freight Offer for Crude Oil from Gocek to Hope Island

Anderson Shipping Brokers

Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: LNG Cargo Offer - Qidong to Kamsar Anch
email_chain.body:
Hi Emmanuel,

Hope you're doing well. We have an opportunity for an LNG cargo of 925MT from Qidong to Kamsar Anch on DAP terms. The vessel we’re proposing is the JAHAM, DWT 319430, LOA 332m. She’s a solid choice for this run.

Initial freight quote is AUD44.59. Laycan is 5-10 May, and loading window is tight due to port restrictions at Qidong (max draft 12.5m, LOA max 340m). JAHAM fits within these limits, but we’ll need to confirm mooring arrangements early.

Best regards,
Kelsey Perry
Anderson Shipping Brokers

Disclaimer: This email is confidential and intended solely for the recipient.

Looking forward to your reply.

Best,
Emmanuel

Demurrage rate is USD25,000 per day, pro rata. I understand your concerns about Kamsar Anch, but we’ve had good experiences there recently. If you’re ready to proceed, we can lock in the laycan and finalize the stem.

Let me know if this works for you.

Best regards,
Kelsey Perry
Anderson Shipping Brokers

Disclaimer: This email is confidential and intended solely for the recipient.

I hope this email finds you well. We are looking to move 307MT of LNG from Haikou to Ningde Anch on FOB terms. Could you please provide a freight quote and vessel options? Additionally, I’ve heard rumors of a competitor booking MSC FEBE for a similar route. Can you confirm if this is accurate?

Best regards,
Julia Bailey

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: LNG Haikou to Ningde Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Julia,

Thank you for your inquiry. I can confirm MSC FEBE (DWT: 228149, LOA: 400m) is available for your cargo. The starting freight quote is USD49.89 per MT. Laycan is 20-25 April, with a loading window of 48 hours. Demurrage rate is USD25,000 per day.

Let me know if this works for you.

Best regards,
Brenda Garza

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: LNG Haikou to Ningde Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Brenda,

Thank you for the prompt response. The laycan and loading window are acceptable, but the freight rate seems high compared to market trends. Could you revise the quote to mid-40s? Also, can you confirm the stem details for Haikou?

Best regards,
Julia Bailey

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: LNG Haikou to Ningde Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Julia,

I understand your concern. After reviewing market conditions, I can offer a revised freight quote of USD45.50 per MT. Stem details for Haikou are confirmed, with loading commencing on 20 April. Please let me know if this works for you.

Best regards,
Brenda Garza

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: LNG Haikou to Ningde Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Brenda,

Thank you for the revised quote. We are close to finalizing this deal. Could you confirm the demurrage rate and provide the CP draft for review? Also, is there any flexibility on the laycan?

Best regards,
Julia Bailey

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: LNG Haikou to Ningde Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Julia,

The demurrage rate remains at USD25,000 per day. I’ve attached the CP draft for your review. Unfortunately, the laycan is fixed due to vessel commitments. Let me know if you need further clarifications.

Best regards,
Brenda Garza

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: LNG Haikou to Ningde Anch

Dear Brenda,

Thank you for the CP draft. We’ve reviewed it and are ready to proceed. Please confirm the final freight rate of USD45.50 per MT and provide the NCB details.

Best regards,
Julia Bailey

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: LNG Haikou to Ningde Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Julia,

Confirmed: final freight rate is USD45.50 per MT. NCB details will be shared shortly. Please proceed with the signed CP at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Brenda Garza

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: LNG Haikou to Ningde Anch

Brenda Garza

email_chain.subject: Freight Offer for Sugar from Makkum to Hamburg
email_chain.body:
Dear Miriam,

We are pleased to offer you the vessel TRUE CAPTAIN (DWT: 180981, LOA: 292m) for the shipment of 10381MT of Sugar from Makkum to Hamburg on CFR terms. The freight rate is EUR32 per MT.

Laycan is 25-28 Feb, with a loading window of 3 days. Demurrage rate is set at USD 12,000 per day.

Please let us know if this works for you or if you require further details.

Best regards,
Sally Le
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar from Makkum to Hamburg
email_chain.body:
Dear Sally,

Thank you for your offer. However, the rate of EUR32 seems a bit high considering current market conditions. We are also exploring alternative transport modes such as rail and barges, which could be more cost-effective.

Could you consider revising the rate to EUR30? Additionally, could you confirm the stem details and any potential adcom charges?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Miriam Amaya

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar from Makkum to Hamburg
email_chain.body:
Dear Miriam,

Thank you for your feedback. Considering your request, we can adjust the rate to EUR31 per MT. This rate is quite competitive given the vessel's specifications and the current market.

Regarding the stem, loading will commence on 25 Feb, and we anticipate a smooth operation within the 3-day window. There are no additional adcom charges expected.

Please confirm your acceptance at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Sally Le
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Sugar from Makkum to Hamburg
email_chain.body:
Dear Sally,

Thank you for the revised offer. We are prepared to accept the rate of EUR31 per MT, provided that the laycan and loading window are strictly adhered to.

Could you please send over the charter party agreement for review? Also, confirm the demurrage rate remains at USD 12,000 per day.

Looking forward to finalizing this shipment.

Best regards,
Miriam Amaya

email_chain.subject: Fwd: Freight Offer for Sugar from Makkum to Hamburg
email_chain.body:
Dear Miriam,

Thank you for your confirmation. I am attaching the charter party agreement for your review. The demurrage rate remains at USD 12,000 per day, as previously stated.

Please sign and return the agreement at your earliest convenience to secure the vessel.

Best regards,
Sally Le
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Rate Inquiry for Soybeans from Batsfjord to Berlin
email_chain.body:
Dear Sally,

I hope this message finds you well. We are looking to charter a vessel for the transport of 2524MT of soybeans from Batsfjord to Berlin on FOB terms. Could you please provide us with an estimated freight rate for this shipment? We are aiming for a loading window in early September.

email_chain.body:
Dear Eric,

Thank you for your inquiry. For the shipment of 2524MT of soybeans from Batsfjord to Berlin on FOB terms, we can offer a rate of €39 per metric ton. The vessel we propose is the WINNING SPIRIT, which has a DWT of 179213 and an LOA of 292m. The laycan is set for 1st to 5th September.

Please let us know if this works for you or if you need any further details.

Best regards,
Sally Jenkins
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Inquiry for Soybeans from Batsfjord to Berlin
email_chain.body:

Thank you for the prompt response. The rate of €39 seems a bit on the higher side. Could we negotiate this down to €35? Also, could you confirm the demurrage rate per day for the WINNING SPIRIT?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Eric Robinson

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Inquiry for Soybeans from Batsfjord to Berlin
email_chain.body:
Dear Eric,

Thank you for your feedback. Considering our long-standing relationship, we can adjust the rate to €37 per metric ton. The demurrage rate for the WINNING SPIRIT is set at €15,000 per day. I hope this revised offer meets your expectations.

Please confirm your acceptance at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Sally Jenkins
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Inquiry for Soybeans from Batsfjord to Berlin
email_chain.body:
Dear Sally,

Thank you for the revised offer. We agree to the rate of €37 per metric ton and the demurrage rate of €15,000 per day. Please proceed with the necessary arrangements for the WINNING SPIRIT with the laycan of 1st to 5th September.

Looking forward to the final confirmation.

Best regards,
Eric Robinson

email_chain.subject: Fwd: Final Confirmation for Soybeans from Batsfjord to Berlin
email_chain.body:
Dear Eric,

Thank you for your confirmation. We have finalized the booking for the WINNING SPIRIT with the agreed terms. The laycan remains 1st to 5th September, and the demurrage rate is confirmed at €15,000 per day. Please find attached the final charter party for your review and signature.

Should you have any further questions, do not hesitate to contact us.

Best regards,
Sally Jenkins
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Freight Offer for Soybeans - LEXIE
email_chain.body:
Hi Bonnie,

Hope you're doing well. We’ve got the LEXIE available for your Soybeans cargo from Sitrah to Port Du Crouesty. She’s a solid vessel with a DWT of 298,911 and LOA of 332m, so plenty of space for your 11,392MT.

We’re quoting $57 per MT on DAP terms. Laycan is 20-25 Nov, and the loading window is tight but manageable. Demurrage rate is set at $15,000 per day.

Let me know your thoughts. Happy to discuss further.

Best,
Casey

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Soybeans - LEXIE
email_chain.body:
Hi Casey,

Thanks for the offer. Given the current economic slowdown and falling trade volumes, $57 seems a bit steep. We’re seeing weaker demand across the board, so I was hoping for something closer to $52.

Also, can you confirm the stem dates and any flexibility on the laycan? Let me know.

Cheers,
Bonnie

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Soybeans - LEXIE
email_chain.body:
Hi Bonnie,

I hear you on the market conditions, but $57 is already quite competitive given the vessel specs and the tight loading window. That said, I can stretch to $55 if we can lock this in today.

Laycan is firm at 20-25 Nov, but I can check with the owners about a slight extension if needed. Let me know if $55 works for you.

Best,
Casey

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Soybeans - LEXIE
email_chain.body:
Hi Casey,

Thanks for the flexibility. $55 sounds reasonable, but we’d need the laycan extended to 27 Nov at the latest. Also, can you confirm the demurrage rate remains at $15,000 per day?

If all looks good, we can proceed.

Cheers,
Bonnie

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Soybeans - LEXIE
email_chain.body:
Hi Bonnie,

Great news – owners have agreed to extend the laycan to 27 Nov. Demurrage rate stays at $15,000 per day. So, we’re looking at $55 per MT on DAP terms, 11,392MT of Soybeans, loading in Sitrah and discharging in Port Du Crouesty.

If this works, let’s finalize the fixture. I’ll send over the recap shortly.

Best,
Casey

Charles

Best regards,
Jake Mcdonald

email_chain.body:

We acknowledge your counteroffer. However, considering the current market conditions and the premium service we provide, the best we can offer is USD80.00 per metric ton. We trust this rate reflects the value and reliability of our service.

Please confirm your acceptance at your earliest convenience.

Barbara Gallegos
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

Best regards,
Jake Mcdonald

email_chain.body:

Barbara Gallegos

Global Maritime Brokers

Maritime Exchange Ltd.

Please note that due to recent increases in bunker prices, a Bunker Adjustment Factor (BAF) of $5.00 per metric ton will apply. This brings the total freight rate to $104.50 per metric ton.

Best regards,
Luz Marin
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.body:

Additionally, could you confirm the laycan and the demurrage rate per day for this vessel?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Teresa Kim

email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Kim,

Thank you for your email. The BAF is calculated based on the current market conditions and the recent spike in fuel prices. However, we can consider a reduced BAF of $3.00 per metric ton, bringing the total freight rate to $102.50 per metric ton.

The laycan for the ULSAN EXPRESS is 25th-30th January, and the demurrage rate is $15,000 per day.

Please let us know if this revised rate is acceptable.

Best regards,
Luz Marin
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Rice Shipment - Phuket to Buenos Aires
email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Teresa Kim

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Rice Shipment - Phuket to Buenos Aires
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Kim,

The loading window is 48 hours from the vessel's arrival at Phuket. There are no specific stem requirements, but we recommend ensuring that the cargo is ready for loading to avoid any delays.

Please let us know your decision at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Luz Marin
Maritime Exchange Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote for Rice Shipment - Phuket to Buenos Aires
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Marin,

After careful consideration, we accept your revised freight rate of $102.50 per metric ton. Please proceed with the necessary arrangements for the ULSAN EXPRESS.

We will ensure the cargo is ready for loading within the specified window.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Best regards,
Teresa Kim

email_chain.subject: Market Update: Aluminum Freight Rates & Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Jacob,

Hope you're doing well. Just wanted to give you a quick update on the market. Rates for Aluminum shipments from Yantai to Laem Chabang are currently hovering around $43.82/MT on a CIF basis. Vessel availability is tight, but we’ve got the CAPE BROLGA (DWT: 211982, LOA: 300m) in the mix, which could be a good fit for your 8824MT cargo.

Laycan is looking around 20-25 Nov, but we’ll need to confirm stem details. Demurrage rate is at $15,000/day, so we’ll need to keep loading/discharge windows tight.

Let me know if you’re interested, and we can lock this in ASAP.

Cheers,
April

email_chain.subject: Re: Market Update: Aluminum Freight Rates & Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi April,

Thanks for the update. $43.82 seems a bit steep given the current market. Can you do better? Also, can you confirm if the CAPE BROLGA is WIBON compliant? We’ve had issues with delays at Yantai before, so we need to make sure the vessel can berth without waiting for tides.

Let me know.

Best,
Jacob

email_chain.subject: Re: Re: Market Update: Aluminum Freight Rates & Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Jacob,

Thanks for getting back. I hear you on the rate—let me see what I can do. I can probably bring it down to $42.50/MT, but that’s as low as I can go right now. As for the CAPE BROLGA, yes, she’s WIBON compliant, so no worries about tidal delays at Yantai.

Laycan is still 20-25 Nov, but we’ll need to finalize stem details soon. Let me know if $42.50 works for you.

Cheers,
April

email_chain.subject: Re: Re: Re: Market Update: Aluminum Freight Rates & Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi April,

$42.50 sounds better. Let’s lock it in. Can you confirm the laycan and send over the fixture recap? Also, please ensure the demurrage rate is capped at $15,000/day—we don’t want any surprises.

Thanks,
Jacob

Hi Jacob,

Great, thanks for confirming. Here’s the recap:

- Commodity: Aluminum

- Load Port: Yantai

- Vessel: CAPE BROLGA (WIBON compliant)

April

Hope you're doing well. I wanted to let you know about a potential opportunity for a wheat shipment from Taizhou to Copenhagen. We have a vessel, LNG IMO, available with a DWT of 83688 and LOA of 288m. The cargo size is 2982MT, and the starting freight quote is USD62 per MT on CFR terms.

Also, just a heads-up, I heard that another broker is offering a similar rate for a different vessel, but I believe our offer is more competitive given the vessel's specifications.

Let me know if you're interested, and we can discuss further details.

Best regards,
Lorena

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat shipment from Taizhou to Copenhagen
email_chain.body:
Hi Lorena,

Thanks for the info. The rate seems a bit high compared to what we've seen recently. Could you clarify the laycan and the loading window? Also, what's the demurrage rate per day?

Looking forward to your response.

Best,
Veronica

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat shipment from Taizhou to Copenhagen
email_chain.body:
Hi Veronica,

Thanks for your quick reply. The laycan is 20-25 Dec, and the loading window is 3 days. The demurrage rate is USD 12,000 per day.

Regarding the rate, I understand your concern. However, considering the vessel's specifications and the current market conditions, I believe USD62 is a fair offer. That said, I'm open to discussing further if you have a counteroffer.

Best regards,
Lorena

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat shipment from Taizhou to Copenhagen
email_chain.body:
Hi Lorena,

Thanks for the details. Given the laycan and loading window, we would like to propose a counteroffer of USD58 per MT. Let me know if this works for you.

Best,
Veronica

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat shipment from Taizhou to Copenhagen
email_chain.body:
Hi Veronica,

Thanks for your counteroffer. USD58 is a bit lower than we were hoping for, but I can check with the owner to see if they can accommodate this rate. I'll get back to you as soon as I have more information.

Best regards,
Lorena

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat shipment from Taizhou to Copenhagen
email_chain.body:
Hi Veronica,

Good news! The owner has agreed to your proposed rate of USD58 per MT. Let me know if you'd like to proceed, and I can send over the contract details.

Best regards,
Lorena

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat shipment from Taizhou to Copenhagen
email_chain.body:
Hi Lorena,

That's great to hear. Please send over the contract details, and we'll review them promptly.

Best,
Veronica

Best regards,
Lorena

email_chain.subject: Re: Contract details for Wheat shipment from Taizhou to Copenhagen
email_chain.body:

Veronica

email_chain.subject: Freight Offer for LNG Cargo from Yangpu to Quanzhou
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Joseph,

We are pleased to offer you a freight rate of $33.42 per MT for the shipment of 11606MT LNG from Yangpu to Quanzhou on a CFR basis. The vessel proposed is the OOCL TAIPEI, with a DWT of 101147 and LOA of 335m. The laycan is set for 20-25 February 2005. Please note that the demurrage rate is set at USD 15,000 per day, pro rata.

We look forward to your prompt response.

Best regards,
Logan Pena
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for LNG Cargo from Yangpu to Quanzhou
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Pena,

Thank you for your offer. Given the current off-peak season and reduced activity in the LNG market, we were expecting a more competitive rate. Could you consider revising the freight rate to better reflect the current market conditions?

Looking forward to your revised offer.

Best regards,
David Joseph

email_chain.subject: Revised Freight Offer for LNG Cargo
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Joseph,

Considering your feedback regarding the seasonal slowdown, we are willing to adjust our freight rate to $32.00 per MT. This revised offer is based on the NYPE terms, and we believe it aligns well with the current market conditions.

Please confirm your acceptance at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Logan Pena
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Revised Freight Offer for LNG Cargo
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Pena,

Thank you for the revised offer. We are prepared to accept the rate of $32.00 per MT under the condition that the laycan is strictly adhered to, and the demurrage rate is capped at USD 14,000 per day.

Please confirm these terms, and we can proceed with the fixture.

Best regards,
David Joseph

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Terms for LNG Cargo
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Joseph,

We confirm the agreed terms: freight rate of $32.00 per MT, laycan 20-25 February 2005, and demurrage rate capped at USD 14,000 per day. We will proceed with the fixture accordingly.

Thank you for your cooperation, and we look forward to a successful shipment.

Best regards,
Logan Pena
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Soybeans CFR Longhai to Moscow
email_chain.body:
Dear Sergio,

I hope this email finds you well. We are looking to charter a vessel for the shipment of 4718MT of soybeans from Longhai to Moscow on CFR terms. Could you please provide a freight quote and vessel options? We are aiming for a laycan of 15-20 April.

Best regards,
Jessie Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Soybeans CFR Longhai to Moscow
email_chain.body:
Dear Jessie,

Thank you for your inquiry. We can offer the vessel PLATA GLORY (DWT: 300133, LOA: 333m) for your shipment. The freight rate is quoted at $59 per MT on CFR terms. The vessel is available within your requested laycan of 15-20 April.

Please let us know if this works for you or if you need further details.

Best regards,
Sergio Vazquez

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Soybeans CFR Longhai to Moscow
email_chain.body:
Dear Sergio,

Thank you for the prompt response. We are considering your offer but would like to explore the possibility of switching to FOB terms. Could you provide a revised quote and clarify the responsibilities under FOB?

Best regards,
Jessie Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Soybeans FOB Longhai to Moscow
email_chain.body:
Dear Jessie,

Under FOB terms, the freight rate would be adjusted to $55 per MT. Please note that under FOB, the responsibility for loading the cargo onto the vessel would be on your side, including all associated costs and risks until the cargo is on board.

Let us know if you wish to proceed with these terms.

Best regards,
Sergio Vazquez

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Soybeans FOB Longhai to Moscow
email_chain.body:
Dear Sergio,

Thank you for the clarification. We would like to proceed with the FOB terms. Could you confirm the laycan and provide details on the demurrage rate?

Best regards,
Jessie Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Soybeans FOB Longhai to Moscow
email_chain.body:
Dear Jessie,

We confirm the laycan of 15-20 April. The demurrage rate is set at $12,000 per day, pro rata. Please ensure all necessary arrangements are made for the loading window to avoid any delays.

Looking forward to your confirmation.

Best regards,
Sergio Vazquez

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Soybeans FOB Longhai to Moscow
email_chain.body:
Dear Sergio,

We confirm the terms and will proceed with the FOB arrangement. Please send over the charter party agreement for review.

Best regards,
Jessie Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Soybeans FOB Longhai to Moscow
email_chain.body:
Dear Jessie,

Attached is the charter party agreement for your review. Please review and confirm at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Sergio Vazquez

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Soybeans FOB Longhai to Moscow
email_chain.body:
Dear Sergio,

We have reviewed and confirmed the charter party agreement. Please proceed with the necessary arrangements.

Best regards,
Jessie Chen

email_chain.subject: Soybeans CIF Tokyo Bay - COSRICH LAKE Offer
email_chain.body:
Dear Justin, 

Hope you are well. I have good vessel COSRICH LAKE (DWT 297336, LOA 330m) open for Soybeans CIF Tokyo Bay. Loading port Harlingen, cargo size 2160MT. Freight rate is €82. Laycan 25-30 July. 

Also, just FYI, competitor booked MV OCEAN STAR for similar route at €85, but their vessel is smaller and older. Let me know if you need more details or want to fix this. 

Best regards, 
Marilyn Huerta 
Seaway Commercial Brokers 

P.S. Weather in Harlingen looks clear for next week, so loading should be smooth.

email_chain.body:
Hi Marilyn, 

Thanks for the offer. COSRICH LAKE looks good, but €82 seems a bit high. Can you do better? Also, what’s the demurrage rate per day? 

Best, 
Justin

email_chain.subject: Re: Soybeans CIF Tokyo Bay - COSRICH LAKE Offer
email_chain.body:
Hi Justin, 

Thanks for your reply. I can do €80, but this is my best offer. Demurrage rate is $12,000 per day. Laytime is 72 hours total. 

By the way, Tokyo Bay port congestion is low right now, so discharge should be quick. Let me know if you want to proceed. 

Best, 
Marilyn

email_chain.subject: Re: Soybeans CIF Tokyo Bay - COSRICH LAKE Offer
email_chain.body:

€80 is better, but can you do €78? Also, confirm the laycan is still 25-30 July. 

Justin

email_chain.body:
Hi Justin, 

€78 is too low, but I can meet you halfway at €79. Laycan is confirmed 25-30 July. Loading window is 3 days, so please ensure stem is ready. 

Also, just a heads-up, there’s a new regulation in Harlingen requiring additional paperwork for Soybeans. I’ll send you the details later. 

Best, 
Marilyn

email_chain.body:
Marilyn, 

€79 works. Let’s fix COSRICH LAKE at this rate. Please send the recap and confirm laycan 25-30 July. Also, share the new Harlingen paperwork details when available. 

Justin

email_chain.subject: Fwd: Recap - Soybeans CIF Tokyo Bay - COSRICH LAKE

Hi Justin, 

Attached is the recap for your review. Key points: 
- Vessel: COSRICH LAKE 
- Cargo: 2160MT Soybeans 
- Load: Harlingen 
- Discharge: Tokyo Bay 
- Freight: €79 CIF 
- Laycan: 25-30 July 
- Demurrage: $12,000/day

email_chain.subject: Freight Offer for Crude Oil from Long Beach to Jiangyin Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Ramirez,

I hope this email finds you well. We are pleased to offer you a competitive freight rate of $37 per metric ton for the shipment of 6786MT of Crude Oil from Long Beach to Jiangyin Anch on DAP terms. The vessel we propose is the JUDITH SCHULTE, a modern tanker with a DWT of 111861 and an LOA of 300m, ensuring a smooth and efficient loading process.

Additionally, I wanted to inform you that a competitor has recently booked a similar vessel at a rate of $39 per metric ton for a comparable route. This highlights the competitiveness of our offer.

Please let us know if you require any further details or if you would like to proceed with this booking. We are confident that this arrangement will meet your needs effectively.

Best regards,
Amber Torres
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil from Long Beach to Jiangyin Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Torres,

Thank you for your prompt offer. While the rate of $37 per metric ton is competitive, we were hoping to secure a rate closer to $35 per metric ton given the current market conditions. Could you please confirm if there is any flexibility in the rate?

Additionally, could you provide more details on the laycan and the loading window? We need to ensure that the vessel aligns with our schedule.

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Leticia Ramirez
Global Cargo

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil from Long Beach to Jiangyin Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Ramirez,

Thank you for your response. We understand your position and, after reviewing the market conditions, we are pleased to offer a revised rate of $36 per metric ton. This rate is highly competitive and reflects our commitment to providing value to our clients.

Regarding the laycan, the JUDITH SCHULTE is available for loading between 20th and 25th September. The loading window is 72 hours, and the demurrage rate is set at $20,000 per day, pro rata.

Please let us know if this revised offer meets your requirements. We are confident that this arrangement will be beneficial for both parties.

Best regards,
Amber Torres
Oceanic Trade Services

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil from Long Beach to Jiangyin Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Torres,

Thank you for the revised offer. We appreciate your flexibility and are pleased to accept the rate of $36 per metric ton. The laycan and loading window are acceptable, and we will proceed with the booking.

Could you please confirm the stem details and provide the necessary documentation for the shipment? We will also need the demurrage terms in writing.

Looking forward to your confirmation.

Best regards,
Leticia Ramirez
Global Cargo

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Offer for Crude Oil from Long Beach to Jiangyin Anch
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Ramirez,

Thank you for your confirmation. We are pleased to proceed with the booking of the JUDITH SCHULTE for your shipment of 6786MT of Crude Oil from Long Beach to Jiangyin Anch at the agreed rate of $36 per metric ton.

The stem details and all necessary documentation will be sent to you shortly. The demurrage terms, as previously mentioned, are $20,000 per day, pro rata, and will be included in the contract.

Should you have any further questions or require additional information, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Best regards,
Amber Torres
Oceanic Trade Services
